well_activity_remarks_html:
WELL_NAME API12 WAR_START_DT TEXT_REMARK
0 001 608114062100 2014-03-14 03/14/2014: Made up 36" jetting assembly and Low Pressure Housing. 03/15/2014: Measured mud line prior to jetting in (5;310' RKB). Ship's air gap is 82'. Jetted in 36" casing to 5;628'. Top of Low Pressure Housing is at 5;298'. Bull's-eye reading after jetting operations: Orange = 1.5 deg at 015 deg Black = 0.75 deg at 25 deg
1 001 608114062100 2014-03-16 03/16/2014: Finished soaking 36" casing. No subsidence noted. Drilled 30" x 32" hole section from 5;623' to 5;820'; experienced difficulty making good rate of penetration (ROP). Began to displace well to 10.1 ppg WBM. 03/17/2014: Drilled 30" x 32" hole section from 5;820' to 5;967'. Pumped a caliper lignite pill. The lignite was observed at the wellhead. The equivalent open hole diameter was 40". Tripped out of the hole and the ROV installed and measured a bull's-eye on the LPWH (0.75 deg at 008 deg). Picked up and ran 15 joints of 28" casing in the hole. 03/18/2014: Set 28" casing at 5;913' and landed 28" casing hanger in the Low Pressure Well Housing (LPWH). Pumped a total surface volume of cement of 658.5 bbls/ 3;697 cu ft to wellhead. (Total downhole volume (foamed) 783.5 bbls/ 4;399 cu ft). The minimum APD volume was 860 cu ft. Displaced the cement job with seawater. The floats did not hold; so began waiting on cement for 7.5 hrs. 03/19/2014: Finished WOC for a total of 7.5 hrs. Pulled hanger running tool and inner-string out of the well. Made up 26" BHA. Waited to repair the top drive before proceeding. 03/20/2014: Top drive repairs and slip and cut drill line. 3/21/2014: Completed top drive repairs. Tripped in hole and verified TOC at 5;822'. Drilled out of shoe at 5;913' with 10.1 ppg salt saturated water based mud and drilled ahead to 6;145'. 03/22/2014: Drilled 26" hole section from 6;145' to 7;375'. The bite exited the salt at 6;878'. Increased the mud weight at 7;000' to 11.0 ppg.
2 001 608114062100 2014-03-23 03/23/2014: Drilled 26" hole section from 7;375' to 9;584' with 11.0 ppg PAD mud. Note: Shane Young (Chevron) notified Bobby Nelson (BSEE; Houma District) vie e-mail about a half moon Teflon rotary bushing saver weighing 18.25 lbs falling approximatley 82 ft from rig floor to moonpool. No recovery. 03/24/2014: Drilled 26" hole section with 11.0 ppg PAD mud from 9;584' to TD at 10;050'. Pumped 150 bbl 13.0 ppg weighted spacer followed by 300 bbl lignite caliper pill followed by 100 bbl 13 ppg weighted spacer displaced with 11.5 ppg PAD mud. Observed lignite returns at wellhead with 3;426 bbls pumped with ROV. Displaced wellbore to 12.0 ppg PAD mud. Spotted 50 bbls of 16.0 ppg PAD mud at 10;050'. Tripped out of hole with 26" BHA from 10;050' to 9;701'; encountered drag at 9;701'. Back reamed with 26" BHA from 9;701' to 8;462'. Tripped out of hole from 8;462' to 7;375'; encountered drag at 7;375'. Back reamed with 26" BHA from 7;375' to 6;776'. Tripped out of hole from 6;776' to 5250' with no drag encountered. Re-entered Low Pressure Wellhead Housing (LPWH) and tripped in hole (wiper trip) from 5;250' to 8;954' with no drag encountered. 03/25/2014: Continued tripping in hole from 8;954' to 9;945'; observed drag at 9;945'. Washed and reamed from 9;945' to 10;050' with 12.0 ppg PAD mud. Displaced wellbore to 12.5 ppg PAD mud. Spotted 50 bbls of 16.0 ppg PAD mud at 10;050'. Tripped out of hole from 10;050' to 5;551'. Activated PBL sub and washed 28" hanger and LPWH at 1;130 gpm. Tripped out of hole from 5;551' to surface. Made up casing shoe joint; float collar joint and began running 22" casing from surface to 171'. 03/26/2014: Continued running 22" casing from 171' to 412'. Made up 18" supplemental adapter joint from 412' to 479'. Continued running 22" casing from 479' to 4;470'. Made up 16" supplemental adapter joint from 4;470' to 4;505'. Continued running 23" casing from 4;505' to 4;653'. Made up 18-3/4" High Pressure Wellhead Housing (HPWH) joint from 4;653' to 4;704'. Hung off HPWH in rotary. TIH with inner string from surface to 4;531'. Made up Mechanical Rigid Lockdown/HPWH running tool to HPWH. Tripped in hole with 22"/23" casing from 4;704' to 5;209' on 6-5/8" landing string. 03/27/2014: Continued tripping in hole with 22"/23" casing on 6-5/8" landing string from 5;209' to 5;381'. Displaced landing string; inner string; and casing shoe track with 12.5 ppg PAD mud. Continued tripping in hole with 22"/23" casing on 6-5/8" landing string from 5;381' to 9;965'. Landed out HPHW at 5;295' (10;002' - 22" shoe depth). Engaged MRLD and preloaded HPWH to 2MM lbs. Pumped 500 bbls of 12.5 ppg PAD mud to prepare wellbore for cementing operations. Performed 22" cementing operations as follows. Pumped 50 bbls of 14.0 ppg 2 gal/bbl green dye spacer at 5 to 6 bpm with 250 - 550 psi. Pumped 219 bbls (220 bbls downhole) of 14.0 ppg foamed spacer(12.6 ppg downhole). Pumped 16.4 ppg Class H foamed lead cement slurry. Surface volume: 1;069 bbls/ 6;002 cu ft/ 5;456 sacks. Down hole volume: 1;429 bbls/ 8;023 cu ft. Pumped 16.4 ppg Class H foamed and unfoamed tail cement slurries. Foamed tail slurry surface volume: 45 bbls/ 253 cu ft/ 230 sacks. Downhole volume: 60 bbls/ 337 cu ft. Unfoamed tail volume: 99 bbls/ 556 cu ft/ 505 sacks. Displaced cement with 260 bbls of seawater. Released HPWH running tool and tripped out of hole from 9;819' to 4;531'. Moved rig 500' south of well center. Note: Harry Wilson (Chevron) emailed Bobby Nelson (BSEE; Houma District) notification of 72 hour BOP stump testing. 03/28/2014: Continued tripping out of hole with inner string from 4;531' to surface. Performed rig floor/BOP maintenance work scope. 03/29/2014: Continued performing rig floor/BOP maintenance work scope.
3 001 608114062100 2014-03-30 03/30/2014: Subsea: Successfully vacuum tested dry mates on both pods; LMRP and BOP. Successfully tested umbilical elbow going to Yellow Pod. Drilling: Changed out diverter element. Began re-spooling drill line. 03/31/2014: Subsea: Calibrated depth compensated bottles. Stacked LMRP and BOP. Prepared for BOP stump test. Drilling: Re-spooled drill line. Changed out choke line drape hose. Successfully pressure tested diverter element to 300 psi. 04/01/2014: Subsea: Successfully tested line from HPU test unit to stump; precharged remaining depth compensated bottles to 3;100 psi. Successfully performed PosLock verification test on Blind Shear Rams. Successfully pressure tested Blind Shear Rams at 15;000 psi. Successfully performed PosLock adjustment test on Blind Shear Rams. Successfully competed BOP stump test #1 (16 total). Drilling: Began replacement of tensioner cables #2 & #10. 04/02/2014: Subsea: Continued with BOP stump test. Unsuccessfully performed BOP stump test #11 of 16; determined Upper Outer Kill (UOK) failsafe valve was leaking. Rebuilt UOK valve. Successfully completed BOP stump test #12. Drilling: Continued replacement of tensioner cables 2 and 10. Re-spooled hot line on moonpool reel. Changed out rigid conduit drape hose. 04/03/2014: Subsea: Continued with BOP stump test. Successfully completed BOP stump tests #2; #3; #4; #5; #6; and #11. Unsuccessfully tested upper annular to 4700 psi (test #7). Drilling: Tripped in hole with Blackhawk Dart Catcher from surface to 3;974'. Successfully performed Dart Catcher testing. Tripped out of hole with Blackhawk Dart Catcher from 3;974' to surface. 04/04/2014: Subsea: Continued with BOP stump test. Successfully completed BOP stump tests #8; #9; #10; #13; #14; #15; and #16 (15 of 16 tests complete). Troubleshot BOP stump test #7-- upper annular tested on 5" drill pipe to 4700 psi. Drilling: Tripped out of hole with Blackhawk Dart Catcher from 3;974' to surface. Tripped in hole from surface to 4;500' with Drill String Valve (DSV) test BHA #1 (without DSV). Established baseline flow testing objectives with DSV test BHA #1. Tripped out of hole from 4;500' to 193'. Made up DSV and tripped in hole from 193' to 1;582' with DSV test BHA #2. Successfully established DSV cracking pressure at 100 gpm. Tripped in hole from 1;582' to 2;500' with DSV test BHA #2. Performed DSV testing from 200 gpm to 1;400 gpm at 100 gpm increments. Tripped in hole from 2;500' to 3;500' with DSV test BHA #2. Performed DSV testing from 200 gpm to 1;400 gpm at 100 gpm increments. Tripped in hole from 3;500' to 4;500' with DSV test BHA #2. 04/05/2014: Subsea: Completed BOP stump test #7 (16 of 16 tests complete). Began calibrating depth compensating bottles. Drilling: Performed DSV testing from 200 gpm to 1;400 gpm at 100 gpm increments. Tripped out of hole with DSV test BHA #2. Successfully performed brake test on draw works.
4 001 608114062100 2014-04-06 04/06/2014: Removed boost valve from BOP for repair. Troubleshot Yellow Pod female receptacle. Calibrated and pre-charged depth compensated bottles. 04/07/2014: Opened upper annular housing. Replaced damaged adapter ring seal. Reassembled Lower Marine Riser Package (LMRP). Replaced and tested mud boost valve. Completed installation of Yellow Pod gripper assembly. Stacked LMRP on BOP. 04/08/2014: Split BOP; changed out gasket; and stacked BOP. Performed accumulator drawdown and ROV intervention tests. Pressure tested upper annular on 6-5/8" drill pipe to 250/9;700 psi and 5" drill pipe to 250/4;700 psi for 5 min. NOTE: Bobby Nelson (BSEE; Houma) granted permission to test BOPs after latch up with 6-5/8" drill pipe only; "Provided the stump test was performed with the range of drillpipe planned for the well; the BOP tests performed while latched up need only be performed for those sizes that will be utilized at that time". 04/09/2014: Completed Emergency Hydraulic Backup Sequence test; function test; dry fire Emergency Disconnect Sequence test; and acoustic pod function test. Began soak testing on Blue Pod. Ran 36" casing; Low Pressure Wellhead Housing and 30" jet-in assembly. Note: Ms. Amanda Pena (Chevron) received approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) via email on 01/24/2016 at 15:11 hrs to proceed with steps 1-4 of the drilling procedure for the Anchor 3 well. 01/25/2016: Installed ROV valves and slope indicators on LPWH. Tripped in open water with LPWH; 36" casing and 30" jet-in assembly to 500' above mud line. Moved vessel to Anchor 3 well center and jetted in 36" casing to 5;120' and let soak while watching for subsidence. Top of LPWH at 4;803' MD. Released from wellhead and tripped out of 36" casing with 30" BHA. Tripped out to 4;630' MD/TVD and moved vessel away from Anchor 3 well center. Current MW is 8.6 ppg SW. 01/26/2016: Pull out to surface with 36" running tool and 30" jetting BHA and lay down same. M/U 26" drilling BHA and RIH from surface to 4;583' MD/TVD. Move vessel to Anchor 3 well center. Continue running 26" drilling BHA in open water to LPWH at 4;803' MD. Lower 26" BHA into LPWH with ROV assist; and continue running in hole from 4;800' MD to 5;096' MD. Wash down drilling assembly from 5;096' MD to 5;120' MD. Drill from 5;120' MD to 5;258' MD with seawater. Displace well to 10.1 ppg water-based mud (WBM) at 5;258' MD. Continue drilling from 5;258' MD to 5;652' MD with 10.1 ppg WBM. Confirm top of salt at 5;565' MD. Current MW is 10.1 ppg WBM. 01/27/2016: Continue drilling 26" hole section from 5;652' MD to TD at 6;550' MD. Pump 200 bbl 12.5 ppg sweep at TD. Spot 33 bbl 16.0 ppg WBM from 6;550' MD to 6;500' MDD. Displace well from 10.1 ppg to 13.0 ppg WBM. Trip out of hole from 6;500' MD to 4;840' MD. Drop dart and activate circulation sub. Trip in hole with 26" drilling assembly from 4;840' MD to 5;050' MD and wash LPWH with circulation sub. Trip out of hole with 26" drilling assembly from 5;050' MD to surface. Rig up 22" casing running equipment. Current MW is 13.0 ppg WBM. 01/28/2016: Begin running 22" x 23" casing from surface to 1;660' MD in open water. M/U High Pressure Wellhead Housing (HPWH) to 23" casing and run inner string from surface to 1;561' MD. M/U MRLD to HPWH and lower to moon pool. Run 22" casing on landing string from 1;660' MD to 4;600' MD. Move vessel from safe handling zone to Anchor 3 well center. Continue running casing from 4;600' MD to 4;800' MD and stab casing into LPWH to 4;832' MD. Displace landing string to 13.0 ppg WBM. Continue running in hole with casing from 4;832' MD to 6;517' MD. Land out MRLD tool in LPWH at 4;803' MD and slack off to 550;000 lbs to lock HPWH into LPWH. Rig up lines for cementing. Current MW is 13.0 ppg WBM. 01/29/2016: Continue rigging up cement lines and circulate bottoms up with 13.0 ppg WBM. Perform 23" x 22" cement job. Pumped 200 bbls 15.4 ppg spacer foamed to 238 bbls of 13.3 ppg foamed spacer with nitrogen unit. Mix and pump 688 bbls/3;863 cu ft 16.2 ppg surface cement foamed to 825 bbls/ 4;632 cu ft 13.8 ppg lead cement slurry taking returns to the mud line. Mix and pump 178 bbls/ 999 cu ft 16.2 ppg un-foamed tail cement slurry. Cement returns confirmed at mudline with ROV. Displace lines with 4 bbls seawater and launch nerf ball. Displace cement with 204 bbls seawater. Total cement pumped 1003 bbls/ 5;631 cu ft. R/D cement lines and nitrogen manifold. Pre-load and release from HPWH. Pull out of hole from 6;367' MD to 5;930' MDD; pump down nerf ball and displace well to 13.0 ppg WBM. Continue tripping out of hole from 5;930' MD to 4;521' MD. Move vessel to safe zone and continue tripping out in open water from 4;521' MD to 1;573' MD and L/D wellhead running tool. Continue tripping out in open water from 1;573' MD to surface. Begin rigging up to run riser. Current MW is 13.0 ppg WBM. 01/30/2016: Pick up 90' riser joint and skid BOP to well center. Make up BOP to 90' riser joint and splash BOP to 193' MD. Install BOP test stabs and pressure test choke and kill lines. Good test. Pressure test rigid conduit and boost lines. Good test. Run BOP on marine riser from 193' MD to 2;443' MD. Install test cap and test choke; kill; rigid conduit and boost lines. Good test. Current MW in cased hole is 13.0 ppg WBM.
26 001a 608114066100 2016-01-31 01/31/2016: Pressure test Conduit and Boost lines; good test. Run BOP #2 on marine riser from 2;443' MD to 4;468' MD while installing seals and mux line clamps. Fill up choke; kill; boost and rigid conduits and install test caps. Successfully pressure tested choke/kill lines; mud boost; and conduit lines. Pick up telescopic joint and lock into MRT ring. Successfully pressure test choke/kill lines and boost/conduit lines. Move rig from DOZ to well center and adjust tensioner pressure in preparation for latching BOPs. BOP officially latched up at 23:30 hrs. Current MW is 13.0 ppg WBM in well; 8.6 ppg seawater in riser. 02/01/2016: Transfer weight of BOP and marine riser to MRT. Perform connector test successfully to 2;500 psi. L/D riser handling equipment and install diverter. Troubleshoot supply regulator issue on Blue Pod. Pick up BOP Test Tool and Dual-Cam tool and run in hole from surface to 759' MD . Perform diverter function test from Driller's panel. Continue running Dual-Cam tool in hole from 759' MD to 5;423' MD. R/U lines to double dutch assembly and pressure test lines to 12;200 psi. Good test observed. Current MW is 13.0 ppg WBM in well; 8.6 ppg seawater in riser. 02/02/2016: Pressure test BOP on 6-5/8" drill pipe from Driller's Panel; Yellow Pod; with 8.6 ppg seawater. Completed IPT tests 21 and 22. Performed BOP accumulator draw down test from Yellow Pod on Driller's Panel. Good test. Surface equipment issues lead to bad pressure tests. Troubleshoot surface leak and remedy situation. Continue pressure testing BOP. Successfully completed IPT test 26. Discover leak on IBOP and swap it out. Continue pressure testing BOP and successfully complete IPT test #27. Current MW is 13.0 ppg WBM in well; 8.6 ppg seawater in riser. 02/03/2016: Troubleshoot lower IBOP on top drive not testing. Isolated lower IBOP and continue to test BOP per IPT tests 27 and 28. Rigged down test lines; tripped in hole to 200' MD below the wellhead (5;000' MD) and displace 13.0 ppg WBM out of wellhead. POOH to wash wellhead; then TIH to 5;569' MD (Test Tool depth 4;805' MD) and land out BOPTT. Close lower pipe ram and pressure test wellhead connection to 250 psi low/ 12;550 psi high for 5 minutes with 8.6 ppg seawater. Good test. Back out of Dual-Cam tool and pressure test BOP per IPT test 29. Troubleshoot surface equipment leaks. Current MW is 13.0 ppg below wellhead and 8.6 ppg in riser. Note: Mr. Matthew Nelson (Chevron) notified Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) on 02/02/2016 regarding a malfunction on the Blue POD 5K to 3K regulator that was noticed after initial BOP latch up and diverter testing. Through troubleshooting efforts; we determined that by placing the Acoustic Non-Shear Accumulator Supply and LMRP Accumulator Supply functions in block; the regulator performed as designed; outputting 3;000 psi. On 02/03/2016; Mr. Bobby Nelson granted Mr. Matthew Nelson approval to proceed with permitted operations with the Acoustic Non-Shear Accumulator Supply and LMRP Accumulator Supply functions in block. 02/04/2016: Pressure test from Driller's Panel; Yellow Pod; per IPT test 34. Discovered leak in surface lines and attempted to troubleshoot. Completed BOP testing by pressure testing BSR from Driller's Panel; Yellow Pod; with 8.6 ppg seawater per IPT test 34. Re-engaged Dual-Cam tool and BOPTT. Tripped out of hole from 5;569' MD to surface. Continued pressure testing BSR and casing to 3;500 psi for 30 min; followed by IBOP pressure testing. Good tests. Pick up and make up 18-1/8" x 21" BHA. Begin choke manifold pressure testing. Current MW is 13.0 ppg below wellhead and 8.6 ppg in riser. 02/05/2016: RIH with 18-1/8" x 21" drilling assembly from 2;418' MD to 4;724' MD. Continue troubleshooting and pressure testing choke and kill manifold. Continue RIH to 5;344'. Displace from seawater to 11.2 ppg SBM. Took SCRs and perform choke drill. Current MW is 11.2 ppg SBM. 02/06/2016: Perform choke drill with drill crew. Wash from 6;390' MD to 6;415' MD . Drill cement and shoe at 6;516' MD . Suspended operations due to DP yellow event caused by loss of thruster 3 while thruster 2 was in maintenance mode. Wash and ream rathole from 6;516' MD to 6;550' MD . Drill new formation from 6;550' MD to 6;560' MD. Pump sweep and circulate cuttings above BOP. Position bit inside 22" shoe and perform FIT to 815 psi surface pressure and 13.6 ppg EMW; 13.83 ppg downhole. Wash back to 6;560' MD. Drill 18-1/8" hole to 6;657' MD . Activate 21" reamer and ream back to 6;657' MD. Drill 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 6;657' MD to 7;672' MD . Current MW is 11.2 ppg SBM.
27 001a 608114066100 2016-02-07 02/07/2016: Drilled 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 7;672' to 9;819' on 6-5/8" drill pipe. Mud weight (MW) in hole was 12.0 ppg at 9;819'. 02/08/2016: Drilled 18-1/8 " x 21" hole section from 9;819' to 10;383' and weighted up mud to 12.4 ppg. Encountered lost returns at 10;383' MD with 12.4 ppg MW in hole - P/U 20 ft and shut in on annular. Allow base oil to take down the choke line to establish balance point - calculated EMW of 11.8 ppg to make well static. Displaced 6.6 ppg base oil into riser to decrease equivalent mud weight to 11.8 ppg. Attempted to move pipe without success. Worked/Jarred pipe until pipe became free. Tripped out of hole (TOH) from 10;383' to 9;600'. Displaced 12.4 ppg SBM in well with 11.5 ppg SBM - 80% returns while circulating until riser cap circulated out of well - % returns reduced when riser cap was circulated out. Shut in on annular and displace remaining 6.6 ppg base oil out of riser with 12.4 ppg SBM. 02/09/2016: Line up on 6.9 ppg base oil to spot new riser cap. Monitored well on trip tank - well static. Displaced 12.4 ppg SBM below BOPs with 11.5 ppg SBM - no losses. Flow checked well - no losses. Displaced choke; kill and boost line with 11.5 ppg SBM. Monitor well on choke line; observed 2 bbls/min losses. Tripped in hole (TIH) with 18-1/8" x 21" assembly from 9;600' to 10;060' and spot LCM pill. TOH from 10;060' to 9;545'. Pump bottoms up with 11.5 ppg SBM. Flow checked and observed 12 bbls/hr losses. Lined up and boosted riser volume. Monitor well through choke line; observed 6.2 bbl gain in 5 min. Shut in well. Monitored well with choke closed. No pressure build up observed. Monitor on open choke; watched flow rate decrease from 0.9 bbls/min to 0.3 bbls/min. 02/10/2016: Monitored well on trip tank for 8.4 bbl/min gain; total 6 bbls gain. Closed annular. Spotted 67 bbls 16.0 ppg SBM in riser. Monitored well on trip tank with 0.5 bbl/min loss. TOH from 9;600' to 6;450' with 18-1/8" x 21" assembly. Monitored well - static. TOH from 6;450' to 6;077. TOH from 6;077' to surface. Displace 16.0 ppg SBM in riser with 11.5 ppg SBM. Flow checked well - well static. TIH with 18-1/8" x 21" drilling assembly from surface to 626'. Function tested BOP from Toolpusher's Panel; Yellow Pod - successful test. Function tested diverter from Driller's Panel - successful test. Function tested BSR and CSR from Toolpusher's Panel; Yellow Pod - successful test. 02/11/2016: TIH with 18-1/8" x 21" assembly from 626' to 10;060'. Washed and reamed from 10;040' to 10;383'. Drill 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 10;383' to 11;249' with 11.5 ppg MW. 02/12/2016: Circulate 3 bottoms up. Flow checked well - ballooning at 1 bbl/min which reduced to 0.2 bbl/min. Spotted 67 bbls of 16.0 ppg SBM in riser for trip out. Monitored well on trip tank; 0.6 bbl/min losses. Displaced 16.0 ppg SBM in riser with 11.5 ppg. Monitor well on trip tank - ballooning at 0.1 bbl/min. Spotted 34 bbls of 16.0 ppg in riser. Open annular monitor well on trip tank - loss rate 0.6 bbl/hour. Reamed out hole from 11;179' to 8;824' with 18-1/8" x 21" assembly due to tight spots encountered. 02/13/2016: Reamed out hole from 8;824' to 7;050' with 18-1/8" x 21" with no drag. TOH from 7;050' to 6;516'. TIH from 6;516' to 10;168' - tight spots encountered in suture 3. Washed and reamed from 10;168' to 11;210' - working through tight spots. Flow checked well - well static. TOH from 11;210' to 10;083' - no drag when tripping through suture. Flow checked well - well static. TIH from 10;083' to 11;205' - no drag while tripping back through suture. TOH from 11;205' to 10;080'. Flow checked well - well static. TOH from 10;080' to 9;660'. Flow checked well - slight ballooning encountered. Spotted 34 bbls of 16.0 ppg in riser for trip out.
28 001a 608114066100 2016-02-14 02/14/2016: With well shut in; flow check through gas bleed valves; hole taking 12 bbls/hr. Opened the annular and monitored with same loss rates. Tripped out of the hole from 9;660' to 6;152'. Flow checked with 0.2 bbls/min loss rate and TOH from 6;152' to surface. Washed the 18" SA and wellhead with the Churchhill sub diverter. Rigged up and ran 18" casing from surface to 1;340'; well taking 8 bbls/hr. Note: Mr. Steven Scruggs (Chevron) received verbal approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (Houma BSEE) via email on 02/14/2016 at 10:04 hrs to proceed with setting 18" casing 200' deeper than originally planned. 02/15/2016: Picked up and ran in hole with 17-7/8" x 18" casing from 1;340' to 5;062' - well static when not running pipe; losing 2 bbls/double when running pipe. Function tested BSR/CSR from Driller's Panel; Blue Pod; prior to crossing the BOP. Rigged down the casing handling equipment and rig up 6.625" drill pipe handling equipment. Running in hole with 6.625" inner string from surface to 4;908'. Made up the 18" hanger and RIH with the 18" casing on landing string from 5;062' to 10;152'. Set down weight at 10;152'; worked and pumped 18" casing down to 10;175'. Made several attempts with no success to wash pipe down; decision made to pull 17-7/8" x 18" casing out the hole. Monitored the well on trip tank; well ballooning at 0.5 bbls/min. Spotted 67 bbls of 16.0 ppg riser cap to control ballooning. 02/16/2016: Continued spotting 67 bbls riser cap to control ballooning; 25 bbl/hr losses. Spotted 34 bbls of riser cap to control losses; 12 bbl/min losses. Performed flow check and began pumping out of the hole with 17-7/8" x 18" casing from 10;167' to 5;104' while monitoring losses on the active system. With 18" hanger at surface; removed Dril-Quip running tool and pulling inner string from 4;908' to surface. Rigged up casing handling equipment and pulled 17-7/8" x 18" casing from 5;104' to 4;982'. 02/17/2016: Pulled out of the hole with 17-7/8" x 18.0" casing to surface. Rigged casing handling equipment and boosted slug out of riser with BSR closed. Monitor well on Mini T/T. Tripped in hole with stinger to 6;127'. Function tested BOPs from the Driller's Panel; Blue Pod; and the Diverter from the Toolpusher's Panel; Performed Diverter function test from Toolpusher's panel. Continued to trip in hole to 10;060' and circulate bottoms up. Note: Mr. William Averill (Chevron) notified Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) of a leak coming from what was believed to be the CSR operator. He informed Mr. Nelson that we were troubleshooting and would update BSEE once a plan forward was developed. 02/18/2016: Continued to circulate bottoms up. Pumped 120 bbls 11.5 ppg LCM pill at 10;060'; spotted and pulled out of pill to 9;200'. Lined up Halliburton cementers to pump down choke line and squeezed LCM pill. Squeezed away 152 bbls without any pressure response; indicating LCM was effective. Decision was made to rig up cement lines and prepare to spot balanced plug to squeeze away cement into loss zone. Spot balanced cement plug from 10;060' to 9;260' and POOH to 9;000' and circulate nerf ball with one tubing volume. R/D from cement job and pump slug and POOH to BOPs. Well static after cement plug spotted. Tested the BOPs from the Toolpusher's Panel; Blue Pod. 02/19/2016: Complete pressure testing BOPs from the Toolpusher's Panel; Blue Pod: 250 psi low/ 5300 psi high; successful tests. Pulled out of hole with wear sleeve and jetting assembly. Made up the Dual Cam BOPTT assembly and tripped in hole to 5;282' bit depth and landed the test plug at 4;805'. Performed PDC BOP #2 EHBS test sequence per procedure. 02/20/2016: Finished testing EHBS test as per PDC procedure. Pumped a slug and pulled out of hole and layed down Dual Cam tool. Boost slug out of riser while picking up mule shoe. Tripped in hole to interrogate cement plug that was spotted as a LCM squeeze. Plug tagged at 9;271'. At this point; it appeared losses had been in suture 1 up the hole. Circulated bottoms up to get cement spacer out of the hole. Losses encountered while CBU. Pulled out of hole to 8;452' and spotted a 14 ppg Hi-Vis pill; lost 62 bbls. Pulled out of hole to 8;150' and rigged up to perform cement job. Note: Mr. Steven Scruggs (Chevron) received verbal approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) via email on 02/20/2016 at 10:55 hrs to proceed with revised cement plugback plan to set plugs higher in the hole. Note: Mr. Cole Joines (Chevron) submitted results of successful EHBS test to Mr. Fred Brink and Mr. Bobby Nelson of BSEE.

Lost 19 barrels (bbls) while pumping cement and an additional 68 bbls while displacing the cement in place. POOH with BHA to 6;495' MD/TVD and monitor well on trip tank. Flush choke and kill lines; observe losses at 3 bbl/hr. Boost riser; and loss rate slowed to 0.5 bbl/hr. TIH and tag TOC at 7;406' MD. POOH to 7;002' MD/TVD above suture and spot LCM pill. Pull above pill and squeeze into formation (159 bbls squeezed). Current mud weight is 11.5 ppg SBM. 02/22/2016: Bled back 16 bbls after squeezing; then opened annular and monitored well. No flow. TIH and tag TOC at 7;406' MD and circulated bottoms up. Pump out of hole to 6;483' MD. Lost 44 bbls while pumping out of hole. Circulated bottoms up and monitored well; losing at 3.5 bbls/hr. TIH and tag TOC then POOH to 7;395' MD. Pump 369 bbls (2;072 cu ft) of 17 ppg cement at 5 bpm. Displace cement and POOH to above the cement plug. Total of 240 bbls lost during cementing job. Monitor well on trip tank while WOC; no losses observed. POOH to above the BOP and function BSR and CSR from Toolpusher's Panel; Yellow Pod; Good test. Continue to POOH to 4;443' MD and function diverter from Driller's Panel; good test. Continue to POOH to surface. Inspected mule shoe and TIH with same to 2;826' MD. Current mud weight is 11.5 ppg SBM. 02/23/2016: Continue TIH and tag TOC at 7;114' MD. P/U to 7;109' MD. Pump 246 bbls (1;381 cu ft) of 17 ppg cement at 5 bpm. Displace cement and POOH to above the cement plug. No losses observed. Circulate drill string and POOH with mule shoe. M/U 18-1/8" x 21" BHA and TIH to 4;750' MD; proper displacement observed. Current mud weight is 11.5 ppg SBM. 02/24/2016: Continue TIH and tag TOC at 6;530' MD. Drilled cement to 6;605' MD and circulated bottoms up. Displaced to 11.7 ppg water based mud (WBM) and then pulled into shoe and prepared surface pits for WBM returns. Complete WBM displacement and POOH with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA to surface. Current mud weight is 11.7 ppg WBM. 02/25/2016: TIH with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA to 1;103' MD and function BSR/CSR from Driller's Panel; Blue Pod; good test. TIH to 6;500' MD; then pull (1) stand and perform diverter function test from Toolpusher's Panel; good test. Space out an perform BOP function test from Driller's Panel; Yellow Pod; good test. TIH to 6;500' MD and displace from 11.7 ppg WBM to 11.5 ppg WBM. Current mud weight is 11.5 ppg WBM. 02/26/2016: Completed mud weight reduction to 11.5 ppg. Commenced drilling; kicking off at 6;751' MD; and drilled ahead to 7;116' MD. Pumped out of hole to 6;632' MD and opened reamer. Open hole to 21" from 6;620' MD bit depth to 6;840' MD bit depth. Current mud weight is 11.5 ppg WBM. 02/27/2016: Continue opening hole to 21" to 7;116' MD bit depth. Drill head to 7;151' MD and circulated bottoms up. POOH with BHA to reconfigure with a rock bit due to slow ROP. Current mud weight is 11.5 ppg WBM.

Reinstall and torque top plate on diverter. 02/24/2017: Rig up riser running tool and pick up BOP landing joint. Lower and lock slip joint; transfer weight from tensioners to block and unlatch BOP from emergency wellhead. Position auxiliary well rotary over well center. Land and engage wellhead running tool in emergency wellhead from auxiliary rotary while laying down BOP landing joint on main rotary. Service slip joint and lay out while TOH with emergency wellhead on auxiliary rotary. Pull BOP from 4;885' MD to 285' MD. RIH from auxiliary rotary and tag surface cement plug with 30k down on the auxiliary rotary at 5;138' MD. 02/25/2017: Continue pulling BOP on marine riser on the main rotary from 285' MD to surface and place in setback area. Rig down riser handling equipment. Moved rig to safe handling zone; performed clear bottom survey and retrieved 8 compatts with ROV. Made preparations for heavy lift inspection. TOH on auxiliary rotary to surface and installed drill collar protector. Moved rig off Anchor 4 BP01 well at 12:00 hours.

well_activity_remarks_dict.TEXT_REMARK:
03/14/2014: Made up 36" jetting assembly and Low Pressure Housing.

03/15/2014: Measured mud line prior to jetting in (5;310' RKB). Ship's air gap is 82'. Jetted in 36" casing to 5;628'. Top of Low Pressure Housing is at 5;298'. 
 
Bull's-eye reading after jetting operations: 
Orange = 1.5 deg at 015 deg 
Black  = 0.75 deg at 25 deg

03/16/2014: Finished soaking 36" casing. No subsidence noted. Drilled 30" x 32" hole section from 5;623' to 5;820'; experienced difficulty making good rate of penetration (ROP). Began to displace well to 10.1 ppg WBM.

03/17/2014: Drilled 30" x 32" hole section from 5;820' to 5;967'. Pumped a caliper lignite pill. The lignite was observed at the wellhead. The equivalent open hole diameter was 40". Tripped out of the hole and the ROV installed and measured a bull's-eye on the LPWH (0.75 deg at 008 deg). Picked up and ran 15 joints of 28" casing in the hole.

03/18/2014: Set 28" casing at 5;913' and landed 28" casing hanger in the Low Pressure Well Housing (LPWH). Pumped a total surface volume of cement of 658.5 bbls/ 3;697 cu ft to wellhead. (Total downhole volume (foamed) 783.5 bbls/ 4;399 cu ft). The minimum APD volume was 860 cu ft. Displaced the cement job with seawater. The floats did not hold; so began waiting on cement for 7.5 hrs. 

03/19/2014: Finished WOC for a total of 7.5 hrs. Pulled hanger running tool and inner-string out of the well. Made up 26" BHA. Waited to repair the top drive before proceeding.

03/20/2014: Top drive repairs and slip and cut drill line.

3/21/2014: Completed top drive repairs. Tripped in hole and verified TOC at 5;822'. Drilled out of shoe at 5;913' with 10.1 ppg salt saturated water based mud and drilled ahead to 6;145'.

03/22/2014: Drilled 26" hole section from 6;145' to 7;375'. The bite exited the salt at 6;878'. Increased the mud weight at 7;000' to 11.0 ppg.

03/23/2014: Drilled 26" hole section from 7;375' to 9;584' with 11.0 ppg PAD mud. 

Note: Shane Young (Chevron) notified Bobby Nelson (BSEE; Houma District) vie e-mail about a half moon Teflon rotary bushing saver weighing 18.25 lbs falling approximatley 82 ft from rig floor to moonpool. No recovery.

03/24/2014: Drilled 26" hole section with 11.0 ppg PAD mud from 9;584' to TD at 10;050'. Pumped 150 bbl 13.0 ppg weighted spacer followed by 300 bbl lignite caliper pill followed by 100 bbl 13 ppg weighted spacer displaced with 11.5 ppg PAD mud. Observed lignite returns at wellhead with 3;426 bbls pumped with ROV. Displaced wellbore to 12.0 ppg PAD mud. Spotted 50 bbls of 16.0 ppg PAD mud at 10;050'. Tripped out of hole with 26" BHA from 10;050' to 9;701'; encountered drag at 9;701'. Back reamed with 26" BHA from 9;701' to 8;462'. Tripped out of hole from 8;462' to 7;375'; encountered drag at 7;375'. Back reamed with 26" BHA from 7;375' to 6;776'. Tripped out of hole from 6;776' to 5250' with no drag encountered. Re-entered Low Pressure Wellhead Housing (LPWH) and tripped in hole (wiper trip) from 5;250' to 8;954' with no drag encountered.

03/25/2014: Continued tripping in hole from 8;954' to 9;945'; observed drag at 9;945'. Washed and reamed from 9;945' to 10;050' with 12.0 ppg PAD mud. Displaced wellbore to 12.5 ppg PAD mud. Spotted 50 bbls of 16.0 ppg PAD mud at 10;050'. Tripped out of hole from 10;050' to 5;551'. Activated PBL sub and washed 28" hanger and LPWH at 1;130 gpm. Tripped out of hole from 5;551' to surface. Made up casing shoe joint; float collar joint and began running 22" casing from surface to 171'.

03/26/2014: Continued running 22" casing from 171' to 412'. Made up 18" supplemental adapter joint from 412' to 479'. Continued running 22" casing from 479' to 4;470'. Made up 16" supplemental adapter joint from 4;470' to 4;505'. Continued running 23" casing from 4;505' to 4;653'. Made up 18-3/4" High Pressure Wellhead Housing (HPWH) joint from 4;653' to 4;704'. Hung off HPWH in rotary. TIH with inner string from surface to 4;531'. Made up Mechanical Rigid Lockdown/HPWH running tool to HPWH. Tripped in hole with 22"/23" casing from 4;704' to 5;209' on 6-5/8" landing string.

03/27/2014: Continued tripping in hole with 22"/23" casing on 6-5/8" landing string from 5;209' to 5;381'. Displaced landing string; inner string; and casing shoe track with 12.5 ppg PAD mud. Continued tripping in hole with 22"/23" casing on 6-5/8" landing string from 5;381' to 9;965'. Landed out HPHW at 5;295' (10;002' - 22" shoe depth). Engaged MRLD and preloaded HPWH to 2MM lbs. Pumped 500 bbls of 12.5 ppg PAD mud to prepare wellbore for cementing operations. Performed 22" cementing operations as follows. Pumped 50 bbls of 14.0 ppg 2 gal/bbl green dye spacer at 5 to 6 bpm with 250 - 550 psi. Pumped 219 bbls (220 bbls downhole) of 14.0 ppg foamed spacer(12.6 ppg downhole). Pumped 16.4 ppg Class H foamed lead cement slurry. Surface volume: 1;069 bbls/ 6;002 cu ft/ 5;456 sacks. Down hole volume: 1;429 bbls/ 8;023 cu ft. Pumped 16.4 ppg Class H foamed and unfoamed tail cement slurries. Foamed tail slurry surface volume: 45 bbls/ 253 cu ft/ 230 sacks. Downhole volume: 60 bbls/ 337 cu ft. Unfoamed tail volume: 99 bbls/ 556 cu ft/ 505 sacks. Displaced cement with 260 bbls of seawater. Released HPWH running tool and tripped out of hole from 9;819' to 4;531'. Moved rig 500' south of well center. 

Note: Harry Wilson (Chevron) emailed Bobby Nelson (BSEE; Houma District) notification of 72 hour BOP stump testing.

03/28/2014: Continued tripping out of hole with inner string from 4;531' to surface. Performed rig floor/BOP maintenance work scope.

03/29/2014: Continued performing rig floor/BOP maintenance work scope.

03/30/2014: Subsea: Successfully vacuum tested dry mates on both pods; LMRP and BOP. Successfully tested umbilical elbow going to Yellow Pod. 

Drilling: Changed out diverter element. Began re-spooling drill line. 

03/31/2014: Subsea: Calibrated depth compensated bottles. Stacked LMRP and BOP. Prepared for BOP stump test.

Drilling: Re-spooled drill line. Changed out choke line drape hose. Successfully pressure tested diverter element to 300 psi. 

04/01/2014: Subsea: Successfully tested line from HPU test unit to stump; precharged remaining depth compensated bottles to 3;100 psi. Successfully performed PosLock verification test on Blind Shear Rams. Successfully pressure tested Blind Shear Rams at 15;000 psi. Successfully performed PosLock adjustment test on Blind Shear Rams. Successfully competed BOP stump test #1 (16 total). 

Drilling: Began replacement of tensioner cables #2 & #10.

04/02/2014: Subsea: Continued with BOP stump test. Unsuccessfully performed BOP stump test #11 of 16; determined Upper Outer Kill (UOK) failsafe valve was leaking. Rebuilt UOK valve. Successfully completed BOP stump test #12. 

Drilling: Continued replacement of tensioner cables 2 and 10. Re-spooled hot line on moonpool reel. Changed out rigid conduit drape hose.

04/03/2014: Subsea: Continued with BOP stump test. Successfully completed BOP stump tests #2; #3; #4; #5; #6; and #11. Unsuccessfully tested upper annular to 4700 psi (test #7). 

Drilling: Tripped in hole with Blackhawk Dart Catcher from surface to 3;974'. Successfully performed Dart Catcher testing. Tripped out of hole with Blackhawk Dart Catcher from 3;974' to surface. 

04/04/2014: Subsea: Continued with BOP stump test. Successfully completed BOP stump tests #8; #9; #10; #13; #14; #15; and #16 (15 of 16 tests complete). Troubleshot BOP stump test #7-- upper annular tested on 5" drill pipe to 4700 psi.

Drilling: Tripped out of hole with Blackhawk Dart Catcher from 3;974' to surface. Tripped in hole from surface to 4;500' with Drill String Valve (DSV) test BHA #1 (without DSV). Established baseline flow testing objectives with DSV test BHA #1. Tripped out of hole from 4;500' to 193'. Made up DSV and tripped in hole from 193' to 1;582' with DSV test BHA #2. Successfully established DSV cracking pressure at 100 gpm. Tripped in hole from 1;582' to 2;500' with DSV test BHA #2. Performed DSV testing from 200 gpm to 1;400 gpm at 100 gpm increments. Tripped in hole from 2;500' to 3;500' with DSV test BHA #2. Performed DSV testing from 200 gpm to 1;400 gpm at 100 gpm increments. Tripped in hole from 3;500' to 4;500' with DSV test BHA #2. 
 
04/05/2014: Subsea: Completed BOP stump test #7 (16 of 16 tests complete). Began calibrating depth compensating bottles. 

Drilling: Performed DSV testing from 200 gpm to 1;400 gpm at 100 gpm increments. Tripped out of hole with DSV test BHA #2. Successfully performed brake test on draw works.

04/06/2014: Removed boost valve from BOP for repair. Troubleshot Yellow Pod female receptacle. Calibrated and pre-charged depth compensated bottles.

04/07/2014: Opened upper annular housing. Replaced damaged adapter ring seal. Reassembled Lower Marine Riser Package (LMRP). Replaced and tested mud boost valve. Completed installation of Yellow Pod gripper assembly. Stacked LMRP on BOP.

04/08/2014: Split BOP; changed out gasket; and stacked BOP. Performed accumulator drawdown and ROV intervention tests. Pressure tested upper annular on 6-5/8" drill pipe to 250/9;700 psi and 5" drill pipe to 250/4;700 psi for 5 min. 

NOTE: Bobby Nelson (BSEE; Houma) granted permission to test BOPs after latch up with 6-5/8" drill pipe only; "Provided the stump test was performed with the range of drillpipe planned for the well; the BOP tests performed while latched up need only be performed for those sizes that will be utilized at that time".

04/09/2014: Completed Emergency Hydraulic Backup Sequence test; function test; dry fire Emergency Disconnect Sequence test; and acoustic pod function test. Began soak testing on Blue Pod.

NOTE: Ivo Terziev (Chevron) provided Bobby Nelson the IPT stump test plan as executed.

04/10/2014: Completed test on rebuilt Upper Inner Choke fail safe valve topside to 250/14;700 psi for 5 min. Found leak on Pipe Ram #1 Lock. Removed and replaced damaged seal in AFT pipe ram #1 lock assembly. Began reassembly of pipe ram #1 Aft lock. Completed depth compensated bottles calibrations. Continue soak test.

NOTE: Ivo Terziev provided Bobby Nelson with a 72 hour notification of subsea BOP testing scheduled for 04/13/2014.

04/11/2014: Completed reassembling and pressure testing operator on pipe ram #1. Pressure tested Blind Shear Rams and Upper Inner Choke to 250/14;700 psi. Pressure tested pipe ram #1 to 250/14;700 psi. Skidded BOP/LMRP to well and made up to first slick joint of riser.

NOTE: Ivo Terziev provided Bobby Nelson with the BOP Well Compatibility Verfication; and the BOP Well Compatibility Verification was also submitted in an eWell RPD.

04/12/2014: Ran 19 joints of riser out of 58 total joints. Pressure tested choke and kill lines to 12;500 psi and rigid conduits and boost line to 5;000 psi.

04/13/2014: Ran riser from 1;723' to 5;153' for a total of 58 joints. Pressure tested choke and kill lines to 12;500 psi. Pressure tested rigid conduit and boost lines to 5;000 psi.

04/14/2014: Made up slip joint with landing joint. Installed drape hoses and SDL tensioner ring on slip joint. Pressure tested the choke and kill lines to 12;500 psi. Tested boost line to 3;500 psi. Landed and latched blowout preventer (BOP) onto High Pressure Wellhead. Pull tested to 100 klbs overpull on both pods. Functioned Blind Shear Rams (BSRs) using Electric Hydraulic Backup Sequence (EHBS) and with the acoustic pod.

04/15/2014: Installed diverter and filled riser with seawater. Performed mechanical bearing test. Tripped in hole with 18-1/8" x 21" bottom hole assembly (BHA). Functioned diverter from both Driller's and Toolpusher's panel. Performed diverter overboard line flow through test. M/U BOP test tool and landed out in the wellhead. Began BOP pressure testing on 6-5/8" drillpipe with seawater from the Driller's panel on the Blue Pod. The rams test pressure was 250/12;200 psi and the annular test pressure was 250/7;000 psi. The IPT Surtec software was utilized for recording testing.

04/16/2014: Completed subsea BOP pressure testing. Function tested BOPs from the Toolpusher's panel with the Yellow Pod. Performed accumulator drawdown test. Began tripping out of the hole with the BOP test tool.

04/17/2014: Closed BSRs with ROV. Successfully tested 22" casing and BSRs to 250/3;900 psi (equivalent to 4100 psi with 9.9 ppg). Function tested BSRs/CSRs and diverter. Tripped out of hole with BOP test tool. Tripped in hole with 18 1/8" x 21" BHA and set wear sleeve in high pressure wellhead. Continued tripping in hole to 9;845'. Displaced Choke and Kill lines to 10.4 synthetic based mud (SBM). Began displacing well from 12.5 ppg water based mud (WBM) to 10.4 ppg SBM.

NOTE: Ivo Terziev (Chevron) requested and received permission from Bobby Nelson (BSEE) to drill ahead following initial latch up. 

04/18/2014: Completed displacement of well from 12.5 ppg WBM to 10.4 ppg SBM. Recorded SCRs and CLFs. Drilled out the 22" shoe track and rathole from 9;907' to 10;050'. Drilled 10' of new formation (18-1/8" hole) to 10;060'. Performed 22" shoe Leak Off Test (LOT) to an 11.2 ppg equivalent mud weight (EMW) with 442 psi. Drilled 18-1/8" hole to 10;095'.

04/19/2014: Drilled 18-1/8" x 21" hole from 10;095' to 11;775'.

04/20/2014: Continued drilling 18-1/8" x 21" hole from 11;775' to 13;085'.

04/21/2014: Continued drilling 18-1/8" x 21" hole from 13;805' to TD at 14;245'. Displaced wellbore from 10.4 ppg synthetic based mud (SBM) to 10.6 ppg SBM. Tripped out of hole with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA from 14;245' to 9;840'. Function tested BOPs on 6-5/8" drillpipe from Toolpusher's panel with Blue Pod. Continued tripping out of hole with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA from 9;840' to 5;875'.

04/22/2014: Continued tripping out of hole with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA from 5;875' to surface. Performed function test on Blind Shear Rams and Casing Shear Rams from Driller's panel on Yellow Pod. Made up and ran 17-7/8" casing from surface to 1;404'.

04/23/2014: Made up and ran 17-7/8" casing from 1;404' to 4;001'. Made up and ran 18" casing from 4001' to 4;498'. Made up 18" casing hanger joint and hung off in rotary. Ran inner string from surface to 4;337'. Made up 18" casing hanger annulus seal assembly running tool (CHSART). Tripped in hole with 17-7/8" x 18" casing on landing string from 4;511' to 9;438'.  

04/24/2014: Tripped in hole with 17-7/8" x 18" casing on landing string from 9;438' to 14;071'. Made up cement head and landed out 18" casing hanger at 9;586'. Shut all surge reduction tools and circulated 1.5 annular volumes noting .5 bpm losses at 6 bpm and 2 bpm losses at 8 bpm. 

Performed 18" casing cement job as follows: Pumped 10 bbls of 13.0 ppg spacer. Successfully tested lines to 5;000 psi. Pumped 170 bbls of 13.0 ppg spacer. Pumped 16.4 ppg Class H lead cement slurry: Surface volume 268 bbls/ 1;505 cu ft/ 1;394 sks. Pumped 4 bbls of 13.0 ppg spacer. Released 2.5" wiper dart from cement head. Pumped 25 bbls of 13.0 ppg spacer. Continued displacing cement with 10.6 SBM; 410.8 total bbls pumped. Lift pressure: 900 psi. Final pressure with pumps off: 801 psi. Bled back 2.5 bbls. Floats holding. Released 18" casing hanger from running tool. Set and tested seal assembly to 3;000 psi. Pulled out of 18" hanger with CHSART and circulated 1.5 drill string volumes. Tripped out of hole with landing string from 13;942' to 5;335'.

Note: Jay Gagneaux (Chevron) notified Bobby Nelson (BSEE) that the HPU surface flow meter needed to be repaired. Permission was granted to proceed with repairs but notification would need to be made if it took significantly longer than planned.

04/25/2014: Continued tripping out of hole with landing string from 5;335' to 4;511'. Laid out CHSART. Continued tripping out of hole with inner string from 4;511' to surface. Shut BSR and changed out surface flow meter on BOPs. Successfully performed Casing/BSR test to 250 psi/ 2;70 0psi. Tripped in hole with tailpipe from surface to 1;961'; made up BOP isolation test tool (BOPITT) and continued tripping in hole from 1;961' to 7;268' (5;300' BOPITT depth). Set BOPITT in high pressure wellhead housing. Successfully pressured tested BOPITT to 1000 psi. Began pressure testing BOPs on 6-5/8" drill pipe from the Toolpusher's panel on the Yellow Pod to 250 psi/ 4600 psi; completed 5 of 15 tests. 

Note: Jay Gagneaux (Chevron) notified Bobby Nelson (BSEE) that the HPU surface flow meter had been replaced and is working properly.

04/26/2014: Completed testing BOPs on 6-5/8" drill pipe from the Toolpusher's panel on the Yellow Pod to 250 psi/ 4600 psi; 15 of 15 successful tests noted. Function tested BOPs from the Toolpusher's panel on the Yellow Pod. Function tested Diverter from Toolpusher's and Driller's panel. Tripped out of hole with BOPITT from 7;268' to surface. Functioned BSRs/CSRs from Driller's panel on Blue pod. Tripped in hole with jet sub from surface to 8;874'. Made up riser brush assembly and continued tripping in hole from 8;874' to 13;886'. Began circulation with 10.6 ppg SBM in preparation for wellbore displacement.

04/27/2014: Circulated and conditioned mud at 13;894'. Displaced wellbore from 13;894' to 5;295' with 12.0 ppg synthetic based mud (SBM). Tripped out of hole with riser brushes from 13;894' to 5;320'. Displaced choke and kill manifold; boost; choke and kill lines with surfactant. Displaced riser; boost; choke and kill lines with seawater. Tripped out of hole with displacement tail pipe from 5;230' surface.

04/28/2014: Installed riser handling equipment. Laid out diverter housing. Closed Blind Shear Ram (BSR) and pressure tested to 250/1;000 psi to ensure pressure integrity. Made up riser landing joint; scoped in the slip joint and locked inner barrel. Unlatched Lower Marine Riser Package (LMRP)and moved rig off well center 500'. Removed surface riser equipment in preparation to pull marine riser. 

04/29/2014: Removed goose neck lines; laid out telescopic joint and began pulling LMRP. Pulled riser from 5;153' to 373'. ROV dove and installed a debris cap on top of BOP.

04/30/2014: Pulled LMRP to surface and transported to LMRP set back area. Removed the mud boost valve and installed a blind flange on LMRP.

DGD operation: Completed filling valve packs and pressured up Hydraulic Power Unit (HPU) to 2;900 psi. Initiated Mud Lift Pump (MLP) pumping tests in parallel.  

05/01/2014: Subsea: Installed test cap on LMRP riser adapter and successfully tested mud boost valve blind flange to 250/4;000 psi for 5 min. 

DGD: Completed MLP warm stack procedure. Completed Solids Processing Unit (SPU)-MLP interface test. Commenced Subsea Rotating Device (SRD) tests.

Began Safety stand down meetings with all crews to reflect on commitment to Incident Free Operations.

05/02/2014: Continued with safety stand down meetings. Continued MLP pre-deployment checks. 

05/03/2014: Made up Solids Processing Unit (SPU); Subsea Rotating Device (SRD) ;and 90' slick joint. Stacked MLP to the LMRP. Transported MLP/LMRP to rig center and began to nipple up MLP/LMRP to the SPU/SRD and slick joint.

05/04/14: Made up Solids Processing Unit (SPU) to Max Lift Pump (MLP). Function tested SPU cutters and valves on Subsea Rotating Device (SRD). Calibrated deadman load cell. Splashed LMRP/MLP and performed shallow water test. Tested Sea Water Power Fluid (SWPF) to 250 psi low and 6;600 psi high for 5 mins each. Tested choke line and kill line to 250 psi low and 12;500 psi high for 5 mins each. Tested Rigid Conduit line with subsea test pump to 5;000 psi for 5 mins. Ran LMRP/MLP on marine riser from surface to 204'.

05/05/14: Ran LMRP/MLP on riser from 204' to 2;994'. Performed Dual Gradient Drilling (DGD) subsea equipment checks at 1;104'. 

Performed the following tests at 1;734': 
Tested choke and kill with seawater to 250 psi low and 12;500 psi high for 5 minutes. 
Tested rigid conduits with Erifon to 5;000 psi for 5 minutes. 
Tested MRL and SWPFL with seawater to 250 psi low and 6;600 psi high for 5 minutes.

05/06/14: Ran LMRP/MLP on riser from 2;994' to 5;064' (total of 55 of 55 joints ran). Began installing surface riser equipment.

Performed the following tests at 3;534' and 5;064': 
Tested choke and kill with seawater to 250 psi low and 12;500 psi high for 5 minutes. 
Tested rigid conduits with Erifon to 5;000 psi for 5 minutes. 
Tested MRL and SWPFL with seawater to 250 psi low and 6;600 psi high for 5 minutes. 

05/07/14: Completed installing surface riser equipment. Tested Mud Return Line (MRL) and Sea Water Power Fluid Line (SWPF) to 250 psi/ 6;600 psi. Engaged tensioner ring and transferred weight to tensioners. Landed and latched LMRP on BOPs; verified connector latch by applying 100 klbs overpull. Installed diverter into diverter housing.

05/08/14: Successfully tested kill line surface piping to 22;500 psi. Successfully tested choke line and kill line against isolation valves to 250 psi/ 15;000 psi using seawater. Tripped in hole with 16-1/2" test BHA from surface to 2;091'. Function tested BSRs/CSRs from Toolpusher's panel on the Yellow Pod. Function tested diverter from Driller's panel and Toolpusher's panel. TIH with 16-1/2" test BHA from 2;091' to 5;065'.

05/09/14: TIH with Special BOP Test Tool (SBOPTT) and 16.5" MPD test BHA tail pipe from 5;065' to 5;320'. Pressure tested choke and kill lines to 250 psi/ 15;000 psi. Displaced drill string from seawater to 10.8 ppg SBM. Tripped in hole from 5;320' to 13;771'. Set SBOPTT in wellhead and successfully tested LMRP connector to 5;000 psi for 5 min. Displaced Choke line; Kill line and Mud Return line to 10.8 ppg SBM. Unseated SBOPTT by tripping out of hole from 13;771' to 13;621' and displaced wellbore and riser 10.8 ppg SBM. Continued tripping out of hole from 13;621' to 8;950'.

Notes:
- Jimmy Lozano (Chevron) submitted revised DGD cased hole testing objectives to Lance Labiche (BSEE). Lance Labiche approved the revised testing plan.

- Jay Gagneaux (Chevron) notified Bobby Nelson (BSEE) that the surface troubleshooting that was performed on the HPU surface flow meter while LMRP was on surface did not fix the gallon count error (~40 gallon delay); and that troubleshooting would continue when allowable (drill pipe above stack).

05/10/14: Continued tripping out of hole with SBOPTT from 8;950' to 8;145'. Racked back SBOPTT; continued tripping out of hole from 8;145' to 6;702'. Unsuccessfully attempted to trip in hole with primary Bearing Latch Assembly (BLA). Unsuccessfully attempted to trip in hole with back-up BLA. Performed flowrate testing on MLP from 100 gpm to 900 gpm.

No Wireline Logs Run 05/11/2014: Concluded DGD equipment testing. Tripped out of hole from 6;857' to surface with test BHA #1. Tripped in hole with 16-1/2" x 19" drilling BHA from surface to 4;464'. Function tested BSRs/CSRs from Driller's panel on Yellow Pod. Performed pressure test of BSRs and 18" casing to 250 psi/ 2700 psi from Driller's panel on Blue Pod. Tripped in hole with 16-1/2" x 19" drilling BHA from 4;464' to 6;269'. Made up Special BOP Test Tool (SBOPTT). Continued tripping in hole. 

05/12/2014: Tripped in hole from 9;602' to 11;432' with 16-1/2" x 19" drilling BHA and Special BOP Test Tool (SBOPTT). Landed SBOPTT in WH at 5;295'. Performed pressure test of BOPs (11 of 11 tests) to 250 psi/ 4600 psi. Tripped out of hole with SBOPTT from 5;295' to surface. Tripped in hole with 16-1/2" x 19" drilling BHA from 6;129' to 10;871'.

Note: Jay Gagneaux (Chevron) notified Bobby Nelson (BSEE) that the PSA would continue to run the BOP stack without placing the LMRP accumulators in block and continue operations with the stack as approved by DNV. Bobby Nelson acknowledged notification with follow up email correspondence. 

05/13/2014: Tripped in hole with 16-1/2" x 19" drilling BHA from 10;871' to top of cement at 13;895'. Drilled cement from 13;895' to 14;042' with 10.8 ppg mud. Drilled float collar from 14;042' to 14;047'. Drilled the shoe from 14;088' to 14;092'. Reamed rathole down to 14;128'. Rotation stalled out at 40;000 ft-lb and packed off to 3;500 psi on stand pipe pressure. Jarred upwards and downward. Shut upper annular andtTrapped 2;000 psi on the backside. Jarred down three times with trapped pressure. Rotation and circulation was re-established. Jarred a total of 46 times. Pulled into the shoe and circulated bottoms up while working pipe. Experienced erratic torque while washing and working pipe. Unable to work pipe while pumping. Began tripping out the hole from 14;076' to 10;486'. 

05/14:/2014: Function tested Blind and Casing Shear rams (BSRs/CSRs) from the Driller's panel on the Yellow Pod. Determined reamer prematurely activated. Tripped out of the hole with current BHA. Picked up and ran new 16-1/2" x 19" drilling BHA into the hole to 8;694'. 

05/15/2014: Tripped in the hole with new 16-1/2" x 19" drilling BHA to 14;097. Washed and reamed rat hole down to 14;245'. Drilled 10' of new formation to 14;245'. Performed a Leak Off Test (LOT). Leaked off at 2;176 psi/ 13.7 ppg EMW. Unable to circulate following LOT. Jarred down 4 times. Reamed down to 14;150' and experienced torquing at multiple spots. Began displacing well to 11.0 ppg SBM. 

05/16/2014: Washed and reamed to 14;255' working through multiple tight spots torquing up and stalling out. Activated reamer at 14;245'. Drilled to 14;480' with 11.0 ppg SBM at an average ROP of 63 feet per hour. 

05/17/2014: Performed a trip drill with Crew E. Drilled 16-1/2" x 19" hole section from 14;480' to 15;356' at an average ROP of 110 feet per hour. Experienced erratic angles from angle sensors on the BOP. Erratic readings stopped at rotations below 160 rpm. Began displacing the well while drilling to 11.2 ppg SBM. Stopped drilling to replace leaking swivel packing on the top drive. Rigged up the Double-Dutch sub to continue circulating the well while performing the maintenance. Upon completing top drive repairs; the drill pipe was stuck and packed off. Began jarring operations on the drilling assembly. Jarred up 10 times and down 3 times. Max over pull of 250 klbs and max weight down of 189 klbs applied. Applied max torque of 45;000 ft-lbs. Unable to obtain any rotation; movement or circulation. Monitored well after jarring operations and the well was static.

05/18/2014: Attempted to free stuck pipe by jarring. Unable to become free. Rigged up a wireline top drive entry system and lubricator. Loaded the Halliburton Freepoint tool in the wireline lubricator. Began troubleshooting leaks on the top drive entry system. 

05/19/2014: Function tested diverter from Driller's and Toolpusher's panels. Rebuilt top drive entry system. Ran in the hole with the Halliburton Freepoint tool. Established a stuck pipe measurement of 14;864' wireline measurement. Pulled the Freepoint tool out of the hole and made up the Schlumberger 2-5/8" severing tools. Ran in the hole with the wireline severing tools and severed the drill pipe at 14;858'. Pulled the Freepoint tool out of the hole; rigged down wireline; and began working the severed pipe out of the hole. 

Note: Ivo Terziev provided Bobby Nelson (BSEE) the plan forward after severing drill pipe. Ivo requested a 24 hour extension to function the BOP and diverter. Paul Nelson replied that no waiver was needed as allowances were already in the CFRs.

Tripped out of the hole and laid out damaged and severed drill pipe.

05/21/2014: Function tested the BSRs/CSRs from the Toolpusher's panel on the Yellow Pod. Performed a trip drill on Crew A1. Began tripping in the hole with the 16.5" cleanout Bottom Hole Assembly.

Note: Jerry Freeman and Troy Boudreaux from BSEE (Houma) performed a government inspection. No Incidents of Non Compliance (INCs) were received.

07/23/2014: Continued to trip in hole with cement stinger from 16;719' to 18;472'. Negative tested 13-3/8" EZSV#1 to 1;710 psi (equivalent seawater gradient); good. 07/24/2014: Finished displacing well with 13.0 ppg SBM from 11;000' to surface. Trip out of the hole with 5-7/8" cement stinger from 11;000' to surface. 07/25/2014: Ran in hole with Schlumberger 1.7" casing punch perforation guns to 11;010'. Applied 300 psi on drill pipe then fired guns inside 14" casing from 11;000' to 11;010'; 6 shots per ft. Packer and 14" casing below packer held 4;000 psi. 

Ran in hole with second set of Schlumberger 1.7" casing punch perforation guns to 11;010'. Applied 300 psi on the drill pipe then fired guns inside 14" casing from 11;000' to 11;006'; 6 shots per ft. No observed change in drill pipe pressure or change in trip tank. Attempted to break circulation with rig pumps; no success. Pulled out of hole and rig down wireline; confirmed 100% of shots fired. Pressured up drill pipe to 4;000 psi to attempt to establish circulation through packer and perforations up the 14" by 16" annulus; unable to circulate; packer and 14" casing below packer held 4;000 psi. 

Unset packer; rigged down the Top Entry Assess System and wireline equipment. Pulled out of hole with the packer from 6;304' to 5;962'.

07/26/2014: Continued to trip out of hole with packer to surface. Ran in hole with Schlumberger 4.7" perforation guns and perforated from 11;000 to 11;003'; 12 shots per ft. Unset packer and tripped out of hole.

07/27/2014: Tripped out of the hole with the 13-5/8" retrievable Archer packer from 5;578' to surface. Ran in the hole with a 13-3/4" Halliburton EZSV bridge plug and set at 10;920'. 07/28/2014: Tripped out of the hole with the EZSV bridge plug running tool. Tripped in the hole with a 13-5/8" Archer packer and set at 6;158'; with 6-5/8" tail pipe at 6;185'. Ran in the hole with 1.71" Schlumberger casing perforation guns on wireline through drill pipe to 9;006'. Circulated bottoms up with 13.0 ppg SBM at 1.0 to 1.6 bbl/min with 1;400 to 2;000 psi surface circulating pressure. Unset Archer packer. Rigged up wireline equipment and ran in hole with 1.71" Schlumberger casing perforation guns to add additional perforations to attempt to improve circulation.

07/29/2014: Continued to run in hole with 1.71" Schlumberger casing perforation guns on wireline through drill pipe to 9;006'. Circulated bottoms up with 13.0 ppg SBM at 1.5 to 1.6 bbl/min with 1;980 to 2;050 psi surface circulating pressure. Unset Archer packer and pulled out of the hole to surface. 

Tripped in hole and set a 13-3/4" Halliburton EZSV cement retainer at 8;493'. Estimated top of cement in the 14" x 16" annulus at 7;000'. 

07/30/2014: Tripped out of the hole to 8;483'. Spotted a 500' cement plug (75 bbls 16.4 ppg Class H with 35% silica flour) on top of the EZSV from 8;483' to 7;983'. Note: Gust Woldtvedt (Chevron) received approval from Bobby Nelson (BSEE) to discontine BOP pressure test; BOP function test; diverter function test; and casing pressure test due to wellbore barriers being in place.

07/31/2014: Continued to trip in the hole with riser brushes and diverter sub to 5;623'. Successfully pressure tested wellbore to 1;500 psi with 13.0 ppg mud for 30 min. Tripped up the hole leaving diverter sub at 5;676'. Successfully negative tested the wellbore to 1;385 psi (equivalentsea water gradient). The test pressure was bled to 0 psi with no flow for 1 hour. 

08/01/2014: Displaced wellbore; riser; choke; kill; and mud return line from 13.0 ppg SBM to seawater from 5;676' to surface. Spotted a 314' surface cement plug (70 bbls 16.6 ppg Class H with 35% silica flour) from 5;676' to 5;362'. Spotted 50 bbls of treated seawater (corrosion inhibitor and oxygen scavenger) from the top of cement at 5;362' to the high pressure wellhead housing at 5;295'.

08/02/2014: Tripped in hole with the mud lift pump bearing latch assembly (BLA) to 5;234' and successfully latched into the BLA profile and released. Tripped out of the hole with the BLA to surface. Prepared surface equipment to pull riser.

08/03/2014: Disconnected the Mud Lift Pump / Lower Marine Riser Package (MLP/LMRP) from the wellhead. Laid out the telescopic joint and pulled 23 of 53 joints of riser.

08/04/2014: Pulled the remaining joints of riser and MLP/LMRP to the splash zone.  Removed cables form the Mud Lift Pump and landed the MLP/LMRP on the BOP transporter. 08/05/2014: Laid down the SPU. Jetted the MLP and LMRP with seawater. Transported MLP/LMRP to the aft moonpool. Ran down to the BOP with the Drill Pipe Running and Retrieval Tool (DPRRT). Subsea: Separated the MLP and LMRP to their respective setback areas.

08/06/2014: Unlatched the BOP and moved rig away from the wellhead. Pulled the BOP on drill pipe to the surface; and jetted with seawater. Installed TA cap and pumped preservation fluid into the TA cap and wellhead.

05/15/2015: Continue between well work. Began making equipment preparations to retrieve Anchor 1 wellhead.

05/16/2015: Continue between well work. Tripped in with a Diamond Wire Saw on drill pipe to retrieve Anchor 1 wellhead.

05/17/2015: Tripped in from 4;006' to 5;285'. Landed diamond wire saw on Anchor #1 wellhead. Removed rigging between diamond wire saw and drill pipe; disconnected from saw; and tripped out to 5;150'. Recovered diamond wire saw and tripped out from 5;285' to surface for repairs.

05/18/2015: Tripped in from surface to 5;285'. Attached diamond wire saw to Anchor #1 wellhead and function tested saw. 05/19/2015: Finished cutting off Anchor #1 wellhead with diamond wire saw and ROV. Tripped out from 5;285' to surface with Anchor #1 wellhead. Tripped out from 5;285' to surface with diamond wire saw.

01/24/2016: Completed between well maintenance. Rigged up to run 36" casing and Low Pressure Wellhead Housing (LPWH). Ran 36" casing; Low Pressure Wellhead Housing and 30" jet-in assembly.

01/29/2016: Continue rigging up cement lines and circulate bottoms up with 13.0 ppg WBM. Perform 23" x 22" cement job. 02/05/2016: RIH with 18-1/8" x 21" drilling assembly from 2;418' MD to 4;724' MD. Continue troubleshooting and pressure testing choke and kill manifold. Continue RIH to 5;344'. Displace from seawater to 11.2 ppg SBM. Took SCRs and perform choke drill. Current MW is 11.2 ppg SBM.

02/08/2016: Drilled 18-1/8 " x 21" hole section from 9;819' to 10;383' and weighted up mud to 12.4 ppg. 02/10/2016: Monitored well on trip tank for 8.4 bbl/min gain; total 6 bbls gain. Closed annular. Spotted 67 bbls 16.0 ppg SBM in riser. Monitored well on trip tank with 0.5 bbl/min loss. Spotted plug #1 with 187 bbls (1;050 cu ft) of 16.5 ppg Lafarge Class H cement from 33;600' MD (32;991' TVD) to 32;000' MD (31;527' TVD). Pulled out of open hole cement plug #1 with 5" mule shoe to 31;950' MD (31;481' TVD). Started spotting plug #2 with 234 bbls (1;314 cu ft) of 16.5 ppg Lafarge Class H cement.

02/15/2017: Finished spotting plug #2 with 234 bbls (1;314 cu ft) of 16.5 ppg Lafarge Class H cement from 32;000' MD (31;527' TVD) to 30;400' MD (30;067' TVD). Pulled out of open hole cement plug #2 with 5" mule shoe from 32;000' MD to 30;350' MD. Spotted plug #3 with 247 bbls (1;387 cu ft) of 16.5 ppg Lafarge Class H cement from 30;400' MD (30;067' TVD) to 28;700' MD (28;412' TVD). Tripped out of hole (TOH) with 5" mule shoe from 24;700' MD to 15;315' MD.

02/16/2017: Continued to TOH with 5" mule shoe from 15;315' MD to surface. Pressure tested casing to 3;000 psi for 30 minutes with 15.5 ppg SMW/ 15.8 ppg DHMW; successful test. TIH with 11-7/8" packer from surface to 15;977' MD. Pressure tested Blind Shear Rams from Driller's Panel (Primary) using the Blue Pod with 250 psi low and 3;000 psi high pressure; successful test. Function tested the Blind Shear Rams and Casing Shear Rams from Driller's Panel (Primary) using the Blue Pod; and from the Toolpusher's Panel (Secondary) using the Yellow Pod. Function tested the Blind Shear Rams and Casing Shear Rams from Toolpusher's Panel (Secondary) using the Yellow Pod; successful test.

02/17/2017: Continued to TIH with 11-7/8" packer from 15;977' MD to 24;703' MD. Set the 11-7/8" packer at 24;703' MD (24;606' TVD). Performed a positive pressure test on 11-7/8" packer with 1;000 psi and 15.5 ppg SMW/ 15.8 ppg DHMW; successful test. TOH with packer stinger from 24;700' MD to 17;600' MD. Made up 14" retrievable packer and TIH from 17;600' MD to 22;850' MD. Set the 14" retrievable packer at 5;208' MD (5;207' TVD). Closed the upper annular and performed a pressure test across the 14" retrievable packer to 1;000 psi with 15.5 ppg SMW/ 15.8 ppg DHMW; successful test. 

02/18/2017:  Performed a negative pressure test across the 11-7/8" packer to 2;522 psi with 6.6 ppg base oil and 15.5 ppg SMW/ 15.8 ppg DHMW; successful test. TOH with 14" retrievable packer from 22;850' MD to 17;252' MD. TIH with packer running tool from 17;252' MD to 24;695' MD. Spotted plug #4 with 97 bbls (544 cu ft) of 16.5 ppg Lafarge Class H cement from 24;700' MD (24;612' TVD) to 24;000' MD (23;937' TVD). TOH with packer setting tool from 23;490' MD to 21;179' MD.

02/19/2017: Continue to trip out of hole(TOH)with cement stinger from 21;179' MD to 19;400' MD. Spot cement plug #5 with 164 bbls (920 cu ft) of 16.5 ppg Lafarge Class H cement from 19;400' MD (19;400' TVD) to 18;400' MD (18;400' TVD). Continue to TOH with cement stinger from 19;400' MD to 4;671' MD. TIH with the jet sub and multi-purpose tool from 4;671' MD to 9;660' MD while monitoring well on trip tank; well static. Pull wear sleeve. TOH from 9;660' MD to 4;601' MD. Function tested the Diverter with the Toolpusher's Panel (Secondary). Function tested the BOPs from the Driller's Panel (Primary) with the Yellow Pod and from the Toolpusher's Panel (Secondary) with the Blue Pod. 

02/20/2017: Make up seal assembly running tool (SART) and TIH from 4;601' MD to 9;641' MD (bit depth) with 14" SART. Wash wellhead and seal assembly area from 5;021' MD to 5;029' MD. Space out; perform strip test with annular closed; open annular and land out SART on 14" seal assembly with 60k. Engage SART to seal assembly and close annular. Pull seal assembly and monitor well with annular closed. Monitor well for 30 minutes; well static. TOH with SART and 14" seal assembly from 9;663' MD to 4;476' MD and rack back SART stand. Monitor well on trip tank; well static. Continue to TOH from 4;476' to surface with packer running tool. Monitor well on trip tank; well static. TIH with Weatherford casing cut/pull assembly. Perform shallow function test on casing cutter at rotary. Continue TIH from 1;480' MD to 6;028' MD with Weatherford casing cut/pull assembly.

02/21/2017: Continue TIH with Weatherford casing cut/pull assembly from 6;028' MD to 6;200' MD. Land out Weatherford marine swivel at 5;021' MD with 20k down. Cut 14" casing; latch Weatherford spear in 14" casing and TOH from 6;200' MD to 1;167' MD. Monitor well on trip tank; well static. TOH with inner string to surface. Rig up casing handling equipment. TOH and lay down 14" casing hanger and 14" casing in doubles. TIH with 16" Halliburton packer. Set and positive test packer at 5;600' MD with 1;000 psi for 15 minutes. TOH with 16" packer running tool from 5;600' MD to 3;331' MD.

02/22/2017: Continue TOH from 3;331' MD to surface with 16" packer running tool. TIH from surface to 5;564' MD with 16" retrievable test-treat-squeeze (RTTS) assembly. Wash RTTS setting depth at 5;360' MD and set same. Perform positive test with 15.5 ppg SMW/ 15.8 ppg DHMW on RTTS to 1;200 psi - good test. Pump 153 bbls of 6.6 ppg base oil down drill string and perform negative test on 16" packer to 2;215 psi. During negative test; bypass valve on 16" RTTS inadvertently opened due to heave cycle; which allowed 6.6 ppg base oil to u-tube back through the opened vent line. Decision made to perform negative test again. Pump 155 bbls of 6.6 ppg base oil down drill string and perform negative test on 16" packer to 2;214 psi. Monitor no flow for 30 minutes - good test. Unseat packer and TOH from 5;564' MD to surface with 16" RTTS. TIH from surface to 5;587' MD with mule shoe and riser brush assembly. Make up side entry sub (SES) stand and prepare to displace 15.5 ppg SMW/ 15.8 ppg DHMW SBM to 8.6 ppg seawater (SW).

02/23/2017: Displace well from 15.5 ppg SMW/ 15.8 DHMW SBM with 8.6 ppg SW. Perform flow check following displacement - well static. Spot cement plug #6 (surface plug) with 119 bbls (669 cu ft) 16.5 ppg Lafarge Class H cement from 5;600' MD to 5;150' MD. TOH from 5;587' MD to 5;035' MD with mule shoe and riser brush assembly. Circulate 1.5 times drill string volume. TOH from 5;035' MD to surface with mule shoe and riser brush assembly. Rig up riser handling equipment. Pick up and engage diverter running tool in diverter. Pick up; clean and land diverter on Spider. Remove and replace diverter element. Reinstall and torque top plate on diverter.

02/24/2017: Rig up riser running tool and pick up BOP landing joint. Lower and lock slip joint; transfer weight from tensioners to block and unlatch BOP from emergency wellhead. Position auxiliary well rotary over well center. Land and engage wellhead running tool in emergency wellhead from auxiliary rotary while laying down BOP landing joint on main rotary. Service slip joint and lay out while TOH with emergency wellhead on auxiliary rotary. Pull BOP from 4;885' MD to 285' MD. RIH from auxiliary rotary and tag surface cement plug with 30k down on the auxiliary rotary at 5;138' MD.

02/25/2017: Continue pulling BOP on marine riser on the main rotary from 285' MD to surface and place in setback area. Rig down riser handling equipment. Moved rig to safe handling zone; performed clear bottom survey and retrieved 8 compatts with ROV. Made preparations for heavy lift inspection. TOH on auxiliary rotary to surface and installed drill collar protector. Moved rig off Anchor 4 BP01 well at 12:00 hours.

[{"   ":0,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062100,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-03-14","TEXT_REMARK":"03/14/2014: Made up 36" jetting assembly and Low Pressure Housing.

03/15/2014: Measured mud line prior to jetting in (5;310' RKB). Ship's air gap is 82'. Jetted in 36" casing to 5;628'. Top of Low Pressure Housing is at 5;298'. 
 
Bull's-eye reading after jetting operations: 
Orange = 1.5 deg at 015 deg 
Black  = 0.75 deg at 25 deg
"},{"   ":1,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062100,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-03-16","TEXT_REMARK":"03/16/2014: Finished soaking 36" casing. No subsidence noted. Drilled 30" x 32" hole section from 5;623' to 5;820'; experienced difficulty making good rate of penetration (ROP). Began to displace well to 10.1 ppg WBM.

03/17/2014: Drilled 30" x 32" hole section from 5;820' to 5;967'. Pumped a caliper lignite pill. The lignite was observed at the wellhead. The equivalent open hole diameter was 40". Tripped out of the hole and the ROV installed and measured a bull's-eye on the LPWH (0.75 deg at 008 deg). Picked up and ran 15 joints of 28" casing in the hole.

03/18/2014: Set 28" casing at 5;913' and landed 28" casing hanger in the Low Pressure Well Housing (LPWH). Pumped a total surface volume of cement of 658.5 bbls/ 3;697 cu ft to wellhead. (Total downhole volume (foamed) 783.5 bbls/ 4;399 cu ft). The minimum APD volume was 860 cu ft. Displaced the cement job with seawater. The floats did not hold; so began waiting on cement for 7.5 hrs. 

03/19/2014: Finished WOC for a total of 7.5 hrs. Pulled hanger running tool and inner-string out of the well. Made up 26" BHA. Waited to repair the top drive before proceeding.

03/20/2014: Top drive repairs and slip and cut drill line.

3/21/2014: Completed top drive repairs. Tripped in hole and verified TOC at 5;822'. Drilled out of shoe at 5;913' with 10.1 ppg salt saturated water based mud and drilled ahead to 6;145'.

03/22/2014: Drilled 26" hole section from 6;145' to 7;375'. The bite exited the salt at 6;878'. Increased the mud weight at 7;000' to 11.0 ppg.
"},{"   ":2,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062100,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-03-23","TEXT_REMARK":"03/23/2014: Drilled 26" hole section from 7;375' to 9;584' with 11.0 ppg PAD mud. 

Note: Shane Young (Chevron) notified Bobby Nelson (BSEE; Houma District) vie e-mail about a half moon Teflon rotary bushing saver weighing 18.25 lbs falling approximatley 82 ft from rig floor to moonpool. No recovery.

03/24/2014: Drilled 26" hole section with 11.0 ppg PAD mud from 9;584' to TD at 10;050'. Pumped 150 bbl 13.0 ppg weighted spacer followed by 300 bbl lignite caliper pill followed by 100 bbl 13 ppg weighted spacer displaced with 11.5 ppg PAD mud. Observed lignite returns at wellhead with 3;426 bbls pumped with ROV. Displaced wellbore to 12.0 ppg PAD mud. Spotted 50 bbls of 16.0 ppg PAD mud at 10;050'. Tripped out of hole with 26" BHA from 10;050' to 9;701'; encountered drag at 9;701'. Back reamed with 26" BHA from 9;701' to 8;462'. Tripped out of hole from 8;462' to 7;375'; encountered drag at 7;375'. Back reamed with 26" BHA from 7;375' to 6;776'. Tripped out of hole from 6;776' to 5250' with no drag encountered. Re-entered Low Pressure Wellhead Housing (LPWH) and tripped in hole (wiper trip) from 5;250' to 8;954' with no drag encountered.

03/25/2014: Continued tripping in hole from 8;954' to 9;945'; observed drag at 9;945'. Washed and reamed from 9;945' to 10;050' with 12.0 ppg PAD mud. Displaced wellbore to 12.5 ppg PAD mud. Spotted 50 bbls of 16.0 ppg PAD mud at 10;050'. Tripped out of hole from 10;050' to 5;551'. Activated PBL sub and washed 28" hanger and LPWH at 1;130 gpm. Tripped out of hole from 5;551' to surface. Made up casing shoe joint; float collar joint and began running 22" casing from surface to 171'.

03/26/2014: Continued running 22" casing from 171' to 412'. Made up 18" supplemental adapter joint from 412' to 479'. Continued running 22" casing from 479' to 4;470'. Made up 16" supplemental adapter joint from 4;470' to 4;505'. Continued running 23" casing from 4;505' to 4;653'. Made up 18-3/4" High Pressure Wellhead Housing (HPWH) joint from 4;653' to 4;704'. Hung off HPWH in rotary. TIH with inner string from surface to 4;531'. Made up Mechanical Rigid Lockdown/HPWH running tool to HPWH. Tripped in hole with 22"/23" casing from 4;704' to 5;209' on 6-5/8" landing string.

03/27/2014: Continued tripping in hole with 22"/23" casing on 6-5/8" landing string from 5;209' to 5;381'. Displaced landing string; inner string; and casing shoe track with 12.5 ppg PAD mud. Continued tripping in hole with 22"/23" casing on 6-5/8" landing string from 5;381' to 9;965'. Landed out HPHW at 5;295' (10;002' - 22" shoe depth). Engaged MRLD and preloaded HPWH to 2MM lbs. Pumped 500 bbls of 12.5 ppg PAD mud to prepare wellbore for cementing operations. Performed 22" cementing operations as follows. Pumped 50 bbls of 14.0 ppg 2 gal/bbl green dye spacer at 5 to 6 bpm with 250 - 550 psi. Pumped 219 bbls (220 bbls downhole) of 14.0 ppg foamed spacer(12.6 ppg downhole). Pumped 16.4 ppg Class H foamed lead cement slurry. Surface volume: 1;069 bbls/ 6;002 cu ft/ 5;456 sacks. Down hole volume: 1;429 bbls/ 8;023 cu ft. Pumped 16.4 ppg Class H foamed and unfoamed tail cement slurries. Foamed tail slurry surface volume: 45 bbls/ 253 cu ft/ 230 sacks. Downhole volume: 60 bbls/ 337 cu ft. Unfoamed tail volume: 99 bbls/ 556 cu ft/ 505 sacks. Displaced cement with 260 bbls of seawater. Released HPWH running tool and tripped out of hole from 9;819' to 4;531'. Moved rig 500' south of well center. 

Note: Harry Wilson (Chevron) emailed Bobby Nelson (BSEE; Houma District) notification of 72 hour BOP stump testing.

03/28/2014: Continued tripping out of hole with inner string from 4;531' to surface. Performed rig floor/BOP maintenance work scope.

03/29/2014: Continued performing rig floor/BOP maintenance work scope."},{"   ":3,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062100,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-03-30","TEXT_REMARK":"03/30/2014: Subsea: Successfully vacuum tested dry mates on both pods; LMRP and BOP. Successfully tested umbilical elbow going to Yellow Pod. 

Drilling: Changed out diverter element. Began re-spooling drill line. 

03/31/2014: Subsea: Calibrated depth compensated bottles. Stacked LMRP and BOP. Prepared for BOP stump test.

Drilling: Re-spooled drill line. Changed out choke line drape hose. Successfully pressure tested diverter element to 300 psi. 

04/01/2014: Subsea: Successfully tested line from HPU test unit to stump; precharged remaining depth compensated bottles to 3;100 psi. Successfully performed PosLock verification test on Blind Shear Rams. Successfully pressure tested Blind Shear Rams at 15;000 psi. Successfully performed PosLock adjustment test on Blind Shear Rams. Successfully competed BOP stump test #1 (16 total). 

Drilling: Began replacement of tensioner cables #2 & #10.
