04/02/2014: Subsea: Continued with BOP stump test. Unsuccessfully performed BOP stump test #11 of 16; determined Upper Outer Kill (UOK) failsafe valve was leaking. Rebuilt UOK valve. Successfully completed BOP stump test #12. 

Drilling: Continued replacement of tensioner cables 2 and 10. Re-spooled hot line on moonpool reel. Changed out rigid conduit drape hose.

04/03/2014: Subsea: Continued with BOP stump test. Successfully completed BOP stump tests #2; #3; #4; #5; #6; and #11. Unsuccessfully tested upper annular to 4700 psi (test #7). 

Drilling: Tripped in hole with Blackhawk Dart Catcher from surface to 3;974'. Successfully performed Dart Catcher testing. Tripped out of hole with Blackhawk Dart Catcher from 3;974' to surface. 

04/04/2014: Subsea: Continued with BOP stump test. Successfully completed BOP stump tests #8; #9; #10; #13; #14; #15; and #16 (15 of 16 tests complete). Troubleshot BOP stump test #7-- upper annular tested on 5" drill pipe to 4700 psi.

Drilling: Tripped out of hole with Blackhawk Dart Catcher from 3;974' to surface. Tripped in hole from surface to 4;500' with Drill String Valve (DSV) test BHA #1 (without DSV). Established baseline flow testing objectives with DSV test BHA #1. Tripped out of hole from 4;500' to 193'. Made up DSV and tripped in hole from 193' to 1;582' with DSV test BHA #2. Successfully established DSV cracking pressure at 100 gpm. Tripped in hole from 1;582' to 2;500' with DSV test BHA #2. Performed DSV testing from 200 gpm to 1;400 gpm at 100 gpm increments. Tripped in hole from 2;500' to 3;500' with DSV test BHA #2. Performed DSV testing from 200 gpm to 1;400 gpm at 100 gpm increments. Tripped in hole from 3;500' to 4;500' with DSV test BHA #2. 
 
04/05/2014: Subsea: Completed BOP stump test #7 (16 of 16 tests complete). Began calibrating depth compensating bottles. 

Drilling: Performed DSV testing from 200 gpm to 1;400 gpm at 100 gpm increments. Tripped out of hole with DSV test BHA #2. Successfully performed brake test on draw works. 
"},{"   ":4,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062100,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-04-06","TEXT_REMARK":"04/06/2014: Removed boost valve from BOP for repair. Troubleshot Yellow Pod female receptacle. Calibrated and pre-charged depth compensated bottles.

04/07/2014: Opened upper annular housing. Replaced damaged adapter ring seal. Reassembled Lower Marine Riser Package (LMRP). Replaced and tested mud boost valve. Completed installation of Yellow Pod gripper assembly. Stacked LMRP on BOP.

04/08/2014: Split BOP; changed out gasket; and stacked BOP. Performed accumulator drawdown and ROV intervention tests. Pressure tested upper annular on 6-5/8" drill pipe to 250/9;700 psi and 5" drill pipe to 250/4;700 psi for 5 min. 

NOTE: Bobby Nelson (BSEE; Houma) granted permission to test BOPs after latch up with 6-5/8" drill pipe only; "Provided the stump test was performed with the range of drillpipe planned for the well; the BOP tests performed while latched up need only be performed for those sizes that will be utilized at that time".

04/09/2014: Completed Emergency Hydraulic Backup Sequence test; function test; dry fire Emergency Disconnect Sequence test; and acoustic pod function test. Began soak testing on Blue Pod.

NOTE: Ivo Terziev (Chevron) provided Bobby Nelson the IPT stump test plan as executed.

04/10/2014: Completed test on rebuilt Upper Inner Choke fail safe valve topside to 250/14;700 psi for 5 min. Found leak on Pipe Ram #1 Lock. Removed and replaced damaged seal in AFT pipe ram #1 lock assembly. Began reassembly of pipe ram #1 Aft lock. Completed depth compensated bottles calibrations. Continue soak test.

NOTE: Ivo Terziev provided Bobby Nelson with a 72 hour notification of subsea BOP testing scheduled for 04/13/2014.

04/11/2014: Completed reassembling and pressure testing operator on pipe ram #1. Pressure tested Blind Shear Rams and Upper Inner Choke to 250/14;700 psi. Pressure tested pipe ram #1 to 250/14;700 psi. Skidded BOP/LMRP to well and made up to first slick joint of riser.

NOTE: Ivo Terziev provided Bobby Nelson with the BOP Well Compatibility Verfication; and the BOP Well Compatibility Verification was also submitted in an eWell RPD.

04/12/2014: Ran 19 joints of riser out of 58 total joints. Pressure tested choke and kill lines to 12;500 psi and rigid conduits and boost line to 5;000 psi.
"},{"   ":5,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062100,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-04-13","TEXT_REMARK":"04/13/2014: Ran riser from 1;723' to 5;153' for a total of 58 joints. Pressure tested choke and kill lines to 12;500 psi. Pressure tested rigid conduit and boost lines to 5;000 psi.

04/14/2014: Made up slip joint with landing joint. Installed drape hoses and SDL tensioner ring on slip joint. Pressure tested the choke and kill lines to 12;500 psi. Tested boost line to 3;500 psi. Landed and latched blowout preventer (BOP) onto High Pressure Wellhead. Pull tested to 100 klbs overpull on both pods. Functioned Blind Shear Rams (BSRs) using Electric Hydraulic Backup Sequence (EHBS) and with the acoustic pod.

04/15/2014: Installed diverter and filled riser with seawater. Performed mechanical bearing test. Tripped in hole with 18-1/8" x 21" bottom hole assembly (BHA). Functioned diverter from both Driller's and Toolpusher's panel. Performed diverter overboard line flow through test. M/U BOP test tool and landed out in the wellhead. Began BOP pressure testing on 6-5/8" drillpipe with seawater from the Driller's panel on the Blue Pod. The rams test pressure was 250/12;200 psi and the annular test pressure was 250/7;000 psi. The IPT Surtec software was utilized for recording testing.

04/16/2014: Completed subsea BOP pressure testing. Function tested BOPs from the Toolpusher's panel with the Yellow Pod. Performed accumulator drawdown test. Began tripping out of the hole with the BOP test tool.

04/17/2014: Closed BSRs with ROV. Successfully tested 22" casing and BSRs to 250/3;900 psi (equivalent to 4100 psi with 9.9 ppg). Function tested BSRs/CSRs and diverter. Tripped out of hole with BOP test tool. Tripped in hole with 18 1/8" x 21" BHA and set wear sleeve in high pressure wellhead. Continued tripping in hole to 9;845'. Displaced Choke and Kill lines to 10.4 synthetic based mud (SBM). Began displacing well from 12.5 ppg water based mud (WBM) to 10.4 ppg SBM.

NOTE: Ivo Terziev (Chevron) requested and received permission from Bobby Nelson (BSEE) to drill ahead following initial latch up. 

04/18/2014: Completed displacement of well from 12.5 ppg WBM to 10.4 ppg SBM. Recorded SCRs and CLFs. Drilled out the 22" shoe track and rathole from 9;907' to 10;050'. Drilled 10' of new formation (18-1/8" hole) to 10;060'. Performed 22" shoe Leak Off Test (LOT) to an 11.2 ppg equivalent mud weight (EMW) with 442 psi. Drilled 18-1/8" hole to 10;095'.

04/19/2014: Drilled 18-1/8" x 21" hole from 10;095' to 11;775'.
"},{"   ":6,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062100,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-04-20","TEXT_REMARK":"04/20/2014: Continued drilling 18-1/8" x 21" hole from 11;775' to 13;085'.

04/21/2014: Continued drilling 18-1/8" x 21" hole from 13;805' to TD at 14;245'. Displaced wellbore from 10.4 ppg synthetic based mud (SBM) to 10.6 ppg SBM. Tripped out of hole with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA from 14;245' to 9;840'. Function tested BOPs on 6-5/8" drillpipe from Toolpusher's panel with Blue Pod. Continued tripping out of hole with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA from 9;840' to 5;875'.

04/22/2014: Continued tripping out of hole with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA from 5;875' to surface. Performed function test on Blind Shear Rams and Casing Shear Rams from Driller's panel on Yellow Pod. Made up and ran 17-7/8" casing from surface to 1;404'.

04/23/2014: Made up and ran 17-7/8" casing from 1;404' to 4;001'. Made up and ran 18" casing from 4001' to 4;498'. Made up 18" casing hanger joint and hung off in rotary. Ran inner string from surface to 4;337'. Made up 18" casing hanger annulus seal assembly running tool (CHSART). Tripped in hole with 17-7/8" x 18" casing on landing string from 4;511' to 9;438'.  

04/24/2014: Tripped in hole with 17-7/8" x 18" casing on landing string from 9;438' to 14;071'. Made up cement head and landed out 18" casing hanger at 9;586'. Shut all surge reduction tools and circulated 1.5 annular volumes noting .5 bpm losses at 6 bpm and 2 bpm losses at 8 bpm. 

Performed 18" casing cement job as follows: Pumped 10 bbls of 13.0 ppg spacer. Successfully tested lines to 5;000 psi. Pumped 170 bbls of 13.0 ppg spacer. Pumped 16.4 ppg Class H lead cement slurry: Surface volume 268 bbls/ 1;505 cu ft/ 1;394 sks. Pumped 4 bbls of 13.0 ppg spacer. Released 2.5" wiper dart from cement head. Pumped 25 bbls of 13.0 ppg spacer. Continued displacing cement with 10.6 SBM; 410.8 total bbls pumped. Lift pressure: 900 psi. Final pressure with pumps off: 801 psi. Bled back 2.5 bbls. Floats holding. Released 18" casing hanger from running tool. Set and tested seal assembly to 3;000 psi. Pulled out of 18" hanger with CHSART and circulated 1.5 drill string volumes. Tripped out of hole with landing string from 13;942' to 5;335'.

Note: Jay Gagneaux (Chevron) notified Bobby Nelson (BSEE) that the HPU surface flow meter needed to be repaired. Permission was granted to proceed with repairs but notification would need to be made if it took significantly longer than planned.

04/25/2014: Continued tripping out of hole with landing string from 5;335' to 4;511'. Laid out CHSART. Continued tripping out of hole with inner string from 4;511' to surface. Shut BSR and changed out surface flow meter on BOPs. Successfully performed Casing/BSR test to 250 psi/ 2;70 0psi. Tripped in hole with tailpipe from surface to 1;961'; made up BOP isolation test tool (BOPITT) and continued tripping in hole from 1;961' to 7;268' (5;300' BOPITT depth). Set BOPITT in high pressure wellhead housing. Successfully pressured tested BOPITT to 1000 psi. Began pressure testing BOPs on 6-5/8" drill pipe from the Toolpusher's panel on the Yellow Pod to 250 psi/ 4600 psi; completed 5 of 15 tests. 

Note: Jay Gagneaux (Chevron) notified Bobby Nelson (BSEE) that the HPU surface flow meter had been replaced and is working properly.

04/26/2014: Completed testing BOPs on 6-5/8" drill pipe from the Toolpusher's panel on the Yellow Pod to 250 psi/ 4600 psi; 15 of 15 successful tests noted. Function tested BOPs from the Toolpusher's panel on the Yellow Pod. Function tested Diverter from Toolpusher's and Driller's panel. Tripped out of hole with BOPITT from 7;268' to surface. Functioned BSRs/CSRs from Driller's panel on Blue pod. Tripped in hole with jet sub from surface to 8;874'. Made up riser brush assembly and continued tripping in hole from 8;874' to 13;886'. Began circulation with 10.6 ppg SBM in preparation for wellbore displacement. 
"},{"   ":7,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062100,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-04-27","TEXT_REMARK":"04/27/2014: Circulated and conditioned mud at 13;894'. Displaced wellbore from 13;894' to 5;295' with 12.0 ppg synthetic based mud (SBM). Tripped out of hole with riser brushes from 13;894' to 5;320'. Displaced choke and kill manifold; boost; choke and kill lines with surfactant. Displaced riser; boost; choke and kill lines with seawater. Tripped out of hole with displacement tail pipe from 5;230' surface.

04/28/2014: Installed riser handling equipment. Laid out diverter housing. Closed Blind Shear Ram (BSR) and pressure tested to 250/1;000 psi to ensure pressure integrity. Made up riser landing joint; scoped in the slip joint and locked inner barrel. Unlatched Lower Marine Riser Package (LMRP)and moved rig off well center 500'. Removed surface riser equipment in preparation to pull marine riser. 

04/29/2014: Removed goose neck lines; laid out telescopic joint and began pulling LMRP. Pulled riser from 5;153' to 373'. ROV dove and installed a debris cap on top of BOP.

04/30/2014: Pulled LMRP to surface and transported to LMRP set back area. Removed the mud boost valve and installed a blind flange on LMRP.

DGD operation: Completed filling valve packs and pressured up Hydraulic Power Unit (HPU) to 2;900 psi. Initiated Mud Lift Pump (MLP) pumping tests in parallel.  

05/01/2014: Subsea: Installed test cap on LMRP riser adapter and successfully tested mud boost valve blind flange to 250/4;000 psi for 5 min. 

DGD: Completed MLP warm stack procedure. Completed Solids Processing Unit (SPU)-MLP interface test. Commenced Subsea Rotating Device (SRD) tests.

Began Safety stand down meetings with all crews to reflect on commitment to Incident Free Operations.

05/02/2014: Continued with safety stand down meetings. Continued MLP pre-deployment checks. 

05/03/2014: Made up Solids Processing Unit (SPU); Subsea Rotating Device (SRD) ;and 90' slick joint. Stacked MLP to the LMRP. Transported MLP/LMRP to rig center and began to nipple up MLP/LMRP to the SPU/SRD and slick joint.
"},{"   ":8,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062100,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-05-04","TEXT_REMARK":"05/04/14: Made up Solids Processing Unit (SPU) to Max Lift Pump (MLP). Function tested SPU cutters and valves on Subsea Rotating Device (SRD). Calibrated deadman load cell. Splashed LMRP/MLP and performed shallow water test. Tested Sea Water Power Fluid (SWPF) to 250 psi low and 6;600 psi high for 5 mins each. Tested choke line and kill line to 250 psi low and 12;500 psi high for 5 mins each. Tested Rigid Conduit line with subsea test pump to 5;000 psi for 5 mins. Ran LMRP/MLP on marine riser from surface to 204'.

05/05/14: Ran LMRP/MLP on riser from 204' to 2;994'. Performed Dual Gradient Drilling (DGD) subsea equipment checks at 1;104'. 

Performed the following tests at 1;734': 
Tested choke and kill with seawater to 250 psi low and 12;500 psi high for 5 minutes. 
Tested rigid conduits with Erifon to 5;000 psi for 5 minutes. 
Tested MRL and SWPFL with seawater to 250 psi low and 6;600 psi high for 5 minutes.

05/06/14: Ran LMRP/MLP on riser from 2;994' to 5;064' (total of 55 of 55 joints ran). Began installing surface riser equipment.

Performed the following tests at 3;534' and 5;064': 
Tested choke and kill with seawater to 250 psi low and 12;500 psi high for 5 minutes. 
Tested rigid conduits with Erifon to 5;000 psi for 5 minutes. 
Tested MRL and SWPFL with seawater to 250 psi low and 6;600 psi high for 5 minutes. 

05/07/14: Completed installing surface riser equipment. Tested Mud Return Line (MRL) and Sea Water Power Fluid Line (SWPF) to 250 psi/ 6;600 psi. Engaged tensioner ring and transferred weight to tensioners. Landed and latched LMRP on BOPs; verified connector latch by applying 100 klbs overpull. Installed diverter into diverter housing.

05/08/14: Successfully tested kill line surface piping to 22;500 psi. Successfully tested choke line and kill line against isolation valves to 250 psi/ 15;000 psi using seawater. Tripped in hole with 16-1/2" test BHA from surface to 2;091'. Function tested BSRs/CSRs from Toolpusher's panel on the Yellow Pod. Function tested diverter from Driller's panel and Toolpusher's panel. TIH with 16-1/2" test BHA from 2;091' to 5;065'.

05/09/14: TIH with Special BOP Test Tool (SBOPTT) and 16.5" MPD test BHA tail pipe from 5;065' to 5;320'. Pressure tested choke and kill lines to 250 psi/ 15;000 psi. Displaced drill string from seawater to 10.8 ppg SBM. Tripped in hole from 5;320' to 13;771'. Set SBOPTT in wellhead and successfully tested LMRP connector to 5;000 psi for 5 min. Displaced Choke line; Kill line and Mud Return line to 10.8 ppg SBM. Unseated SBOPTT by tripping out of hole from 13;771' to 13;621' and displaced wellbore and riser 10.8 ppg SBM. Continued tripping out of hole from 13;621' to 8;950'.

Notes:
- Jimmy Lozano (Chevron) submitted revised DGD cased hole testing objectives to Lance Labiche (BSEE). Lance Labiche approved the revised testing plan.

- Jay Gagneaux (Chevron) notified Bobby Nelson (BSEE) that the surface troubleshooting that was performed on the HPU surface flow meter while LMRP was on surface did not fix the gallon count error (~40 gallon delay); and that troubleshooting would continue when allowable (drill pipe above stack).

05/10/14: Continued tripping out of hole with SBOPTT from 8;950' to 8;145'. Racked back SBOPTT; continued tripping out of hole from 8;145' to 6;702'. Unsuccessfully attempted to trip in hole with primary Bearing Latch Assembly (BLA). Unsuccessfully attempted to trip in hole with back-up BLA. Performed flowrate testing on MLP from 100 gpm to 900 gpm. 
"},{"   ":9,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062100,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-05-11","TEXT_REMARK":"No Wireline Logs Run 05/11/2014: Concluded DGD equipment testing. Tripped out of hole from 6;857' to surface with test BHA #1. Tripped in hole with 16-1/2" x 19" drilling BHA from surface to 4;464'. Function tested BSRs/CSRs from Driller's panel on Yellow Pod. Performed pressure test of BSRs and 18" casing to 250 psi/ 2700 psi from Driller's panel on Blue Pod. Tripped in hole with 16-1/2" x 19" drilling BHA from 4;464' to 6;269'. Made up Special BOP Test Tool (SBOPTT). Continued tripping in hole. 

05/12/2014: Tripped in hole from 9;602' to 11;432' with 16-1/2" x 19" drilling BHA and Special BOP Test Tool (SBOPTT). Landed SBOPTT in WH at 5;295'. Performed pressure test of BOPs (11 of 11 tests) to 250 psi/ 4600 psi. Tripped out of hole with SBOPTT from 5;295' to surface. Tripped in hole with 16-1/2" x 19" drilling BHA from 6;129' to 10;871'.

Note: Jay Gagneaux (Chevron) notified Bobby Nelson (BSEE) that the PSA would continue to run the BOP stack without placing the LMRP accumulators in block and continue operations with the stack as approved by DNV. Bobby Nelson acknowledged notification with follow up email correspondence. 

05/13/2014: Tripped in hole with 16-1/2" x 19" drilling BHA from 10;871' to top of cement at 13;895'. Drilled cement from 13;895' to 14;042' with 10.8 ppg mud. Drilled float collar from 14;042' to 14;047'. Drilled the shoe from 14;088' to 14;092'. Reamed rathole down to 14;128'. Rotation stalled out at 40;000 ft-lb and packed off to 3;500 psi on stand pipe pressure. Jarred upwards and downward. Shut upper annular andtTrapped 2;000 psi on the backside. Jarred down three times with trapped pressure. Rotation and circulation was re-established. Jarred a total of 46 times. Pulled into the shoe and circulated bottoms up while working pipe. Experienced erratic torque while washing and working pipe. Unable to work pipe while pumping. Began tripping out the hole from 14;076' to 10;486'. 

05/14:/2014: Function tested Blind and Casing Shear rams (BSRs/CSRs) from the Driller's panel on the Yellow Pod. Determined reamer prematurely activated. Tripped out of the hole with current BHA. Picked up and ran new 16-1/2" x 19" drilling BHA into the hole to 8;694'. 

05/15/2014: Tripped in the hole with new 16-1/2" x 19" drilling BHA to 14;097. Washed and reamed rat hole down to 14;245'. Drilled 10' of new formation to 14;245'. Performed a Leak Off Test (LOT). Leaked off at 2;176 psi/ 13.7 ppg EMW. Unable to circulate following LOT. Jarred down 4 times. Reamed down to 14;150' and experienced torquing at multiple spots. Began displacing well to 11.0 ppg SBM. 

05/16/2014: Washed and reamed to 14;255' working through multiple tight spots torquing up and stalling out. Activated reamer at 14;245'. Drilled to 14;480' with 11.0 ppg SBM at an average ROP of 63 feet per hour. 

05/17/2014: Performed a trip drill with Crew E. Drilled 16-1/2" x 19" hole section from 14;480' to 15;356' at an average ROP of 110 feet per hour. Experienced erratic angles from angle sensors on the BOP. Erratic readings stopped at rotations below 160 rpm. Began displacing the well while drilling to 11.2 ppg SBM. Stopped drilling to replace leaking swivel packing on the top drive. Rigged up the Double-Dutch sub to continue circulating the well while performing the maintenance. Upon completing top drive repairs; the drill pipe was stuck and packed off. Began jarring operations on the drilling assembly. Jarred up 10 times and down 3 times. Max over pull of 250 klbs and max weight down of 189 klbs applied. Applied max torque of 45;000 ft-lbs. Unable to obtain any rotation; movement or circulation. Monitored well after jarring operations and the well was static.
"},{"   ":10,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062100,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-05-18","TEXT_REMARK":"05/18/2014: Attempted to free stuck pipe by jarring. Unable to become free. Rigged up a wireline top drive entry system and lubricator. Loaded the Halliburton Freepoint tool in the wireline lubricator. Began troubleshooting leaks on the top drive entry system. 

05/19/2014: Function tested diverter from Driller's and Toolpusher's panels. Rebuilt top drive entry system. Ran in the hole with the Halliburton Freepoint tool. Established a stuck pipe measurement of 14;864' wireline measurement. Pulled the Freepoint tool out of the hole and made up the Schlumberger 2-5/8" severing tools. Ran in the hole with the wireline severing tools and severed the drill pipe at 14;858'. Pulled the Freepoint tool out of the hole; rigged down wireline; and began working the severed pipe out of the hole. 

Note: Ivo Terziev provided Bobby Nelson (BSEE) the plan forward after severing drill pipe. Ivo requested a 24 hour extension to function the BOP and diverter. Paul Nelson replied that no waiver was needed as allowances were already in the CFRs. 

05/20/2014: Function tested the BOPs from Toolpusher's panel on Blue Pod. Performed a trip drill with Crew E1. Continued to work the severed pipe out of the hole. Circulated bottoms up to the wellhead and circulated up the choke and kill. Pumped 100 bbls of 14.0 ppg SBM high vis sweep and displaced wellbore; choke; kill; and mud return line to 11.4 ppg mud. Tripped out of the hole and laid out damaged and severed drill pipe.

05/21/2014: Function tested the BSRs/CSRs from the Toolpusher's panel on the Yellow Pod. Performed a trip drill on Crew A1. Made up the Dril-Quip Multi-Purpose Tool (MPT) and tripped in hole to retrieve wear bushing. Tripped out of the hole with the MPT and wear sleeve. Began tripping in the hole with the 16.5" cleanout Bottom Hole Assembly.

05/22/2014: Continued tripping in the hole with the 16.5" cleanout BHA. Tripped through the shoe to 14;131' with no issues. Washed and reamed from 14;131' to 18;848'. Displaced the well; choke; kill; and mud return line to 11.6 ppg. Pumped 100 bbl 13.6 ppg high weight; high viscosity sweep.

Note: Jerry Freeman and Troy Boudreaux from BSEE (Houma) performed a government inspection. No Incidents of Non Compliance (INCs) were received.

05/23/2014: Finished circulating a 100 bbl 13.6 ppg high weight; high viscosity sweep. Pumped 118 bbls of 13.6 high viscosity sweep and displaced the well; choke; kill; and mud return line to 11.8 ppg. Tripped out of the hole with 16.5" cleanout BHA.

05/24/2014: Rigged up Schlumberger wireline and ran in the hole with the open hole caliper logging tool. Could not run the logging tool below the 14;135'. Logged from 14;132' up to 13;800'. The hole caliper was out of the range (40 inches) of the tool. Pulled caliper tool out of the hole. Made up and tripped in the hole with a 4.5" cement stinger and magnet assembly. Made up cement head and tripped in to 14;848'. Pumped a 50 bbl 25 ppb nut plug followed by 100 bbl 14.4 ppg weighted sweep and circulated out of the hole. 
"},{"   ":11,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062100,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-05-25","TEXT_REMARK":"05/25/2014: Performed kick off plug cement job at 14;848' as follows: pumped 252 bbls of 14.4 ppg lead spacer ahead of cement. Mixed and pumped 2874 cu ft/ 512 bbls of 17.0 ppg Class H lead cement. Pumped 14.5 bbls of 14.4 ppg tail spacer behind cement.
Displaced cement with 400 bbls of 11.8 ppg synthetic base mud. Pulled out of hole from 14;848' to 12;793'. Pumped 60 bbl scouring pill and 2 nerf balls to clean drill string. Tripped in hole from 12;793' to 13;848'. Unsuccessfully attempted to reverse circulate out cement spacer. Circulated cement spacer out of annulus. Tripped in hole from 13;848' to 14;095' in attempt to tag cement with no success. Tripped out of hole from 14;095' to 9;687'.  

05/26/2014: Continued tripping out of hole from 9;687' to surface. Performed BSR/CSR function test from Driller's panel on the Yellow Pod. Tripped in hole with 16-1/2" x 19" Drilling BHA from surface to 4;750'. Performed Diverter function test from Driller's panel on Yellow Pod and Toolpusher's panel on Blue Pod. Tripped in hole from 4;750' to 7;313'. Made up Special BOP Test Tool (SBOPTT) into drill string and tripped in hole to 9;461'.

05/27/2014: Continued tripping in hole with 16-1/2" x 19" Drilling BHA and SBOPTT from 9;461' to 12;614'. Set SBOPTT in wellhead at 5;295'. Pressure tested BOPs to 250/4600 psi from Driller's panel on Yellow Pod.  Tripped out of hole with SBOPTT to surface. Tripped in hole with 16-1/2" x 19" Drilling BHA from 7;313' to top of cement at 14;111'. Drilled cement from 14;111' to 14;155'. 

05/28/2014: Drilled 16-1/2" x 19" hole section from 14;155' to 14;168'. Drilled 16-1/2" x 19" BP01 hole section from 14;168' to 15;646'. Note: Kick off point for BP01 - 14;168'. 

05/29/2014: Drilled 16-1/2" x 19" BP01 hole section from 14;155' to 17;957'.

05/30/2014: Drilled 16-1/2" x 19" BP01 hole section from 17;957' to total depth of 19;250' MD. Displaced wellbore from 12.2 ppg mud weight to 12.5 ppg mud weight. Circulated and conditioned mud at 19;240'. 

05/31/2014: Spotted 35 bbls of 16.5 ppg SBM at 19;240'. Tripped out of hole with 16-1/2" x 19" Drilling BHA from 19;240' to 13;680'. Performed BOP function test from Driller's panel on Blue Pod. Performed Diverter function test from Driller's panel and Toolpusher's panel. Continued tripping out of hole with 16-1/2" x 19" Drilling BHA from 13;680' to 6;544'. Activated Well Commander and washed 16" supplemental adapter; wellhead; and BOP from 6;544' to 5;134'. Continued tripping out of hole with 16-1/2" x 19" Drilling BHA from 5;134' to surface. 
"},{"   ":12,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062101,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-05-25","TEXT_REMARK":"05/25/2014: Performed kick off plug cement job at 14;848' as follows: pumped 252 bbls of 14.4 ppg lead spacer ahead of cement. Mixed and pumped 2874 cu ft/ 512 bbls of 17.0 ppg Class H lead cement. Pumped 14.5 bbls of 14.4 ppg tail spacer behind cement.
Displaced cement with 400 bbls of 11.8 ppg synthetic base mud. Pulled out of hole from 14;848' to 12;793'. Pumped 60 bbl scouring pill and 2 nerf balls to clean drill string. Tripped in hole from 12;793' to 13;848'. Unsuccessfully attempted to reverse circulate out cement spacer. Circulated cement spacer out of annulus. Tripped in hole from 13;848' to 14;095' in attempt to tag cement with no success. Tripped out of hole from 14;095' to 9;687'.  

05/26/2014: Continued tripping out of hole from 9;687' to surface. Performed BSR/CSR function test from Driller's panel on the Yellow Pod. Tripped in hole with 16-1/2" x 19" Drilling BHA from surface to 4;750'. Performed Diverter function test from Driller's panel on Yellow Pod and Toolpusher's panel on Blue Pod. Tripped in hole from 4;750' to 7;313'. Made up Special BOP Test Tool (SBOPTT) into drill string and tripped in hole to 9;461'.

05/27/2014: Continued tripping in hole with 16-1/2" x 19" Drilling BHA and SBOPTT from 9;461' to 12;614'. Set SBOPTT in wellhead at 5;295'. Pressure tested BOPs to 250/4600 psi from Driller's panel on Yellow Pod.  Tripped out of hole with SBOPTT to surface. Tripped in hole with 16-1/2" x 19" Drilling BHA from 7;313' to top of cement at 14;111'. Drilled cement from 14;111' to 14;155'. 

05/28/2014: Drilled 16-1/2" x 19" hole section from 14;155' to 14;168'. Drilled 16-1/2" x 19" BP01 hole section from 14;168' to 15;646'. Note: Kick off point for BP01 - 14;168'. 

05/29/2014: Drilled 16-1/2" x 19" BP01 hole section from 14;155' to 17;957'.

05/30/2014: Drilled 16-1/2" x 19" BP01 hole section from 17;957' to total depth of 19;250' MD. Displaced wellbore from 12.2 ppg mud weight to 12.5 ppg mud weight. Circulated and conditioned mud at 19;240'. 

05/31/2014: Spotted 35 bbls of 16.5 ppg SBM at 19;240'. Tripped out of hole with 16-1/2" x 19" Drilling BHA from 19;240' to 13;680'. Performed BOP function test from Driller's panel on Blue Pod. Performed Diverter function test from Driller's panel and Toolpusher's panel. Continued tripping out of hole with 16-1/2" x 19" Drilling BHA from 13;680' to 6;544'. Activated Well Commander and washed 16" supplemental adapter; wellhead; and BOP from 6;544' to 5;134'. Continued tripping out of hole with 16-1/2" x 19" Drilling BHA from 5;134' to surface. 
"},{"   ":13,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062101,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-06-01","TEXT_REMARK":"06/01/2014: Made up and ran 16.15" casing shoe track from surface to 139'. Ran 16.15" casing from 139' to 1;978'. Ran 16.04" casing from 1;978' to 5;552'. 

06/02/2014: Continued running 16.04" casing from 5;552' to 13;580'.

06/03/2014: Made up 16" hanger on Casing Hanger Seal Assembly Running Tool (CHSART) to 16.04" casing string from 13;580' to 13;625'. Tripped in hole with landing string from 13;625' to 19;122'. Landed 16" casing hanger in supplemental adapter at 5;529'. 

Performed casing cementing operation as follows: Pumped 200 bbls of 14.4 ppg lead spacer. Pumped 4 bbls 16.4 ppg Class H tail cement slurry; released bottom dart from cement head. Continued pumping 372 bbls (376 bbls total) of 16.4 ppg Class H tail cement slurry. Released top dart from cement head and pumped 20 bbls of 16.4 ppg Class H tail cement slurry. Total 16.4 ppg Class H tail cement: surface volume: 396 bbls/ 2;224 cu ft/ 2;040 sks. Pumped 30 bbls of 14.4 ppg tail spacer. Displaced cement with 3;023 bbls 12.5 ppg SBM. Top plug successfully bumped upper float collar with 500 psi over circulating pressure noted. Bled back 23.3 bbls of compressibility and determined floats successfully holding initially. Set and tested 16" casing hanger seal assembly to 6;000 psi.

06/04/2014: Determined floats were not holding. Waited on cement with drill pipe pressure (lift pressure) at 687 psi. Bled off drill pipe pressure; released 16" CHSART and tripped out of hole with landing string from 5;529' to surface. Tripped in hole with 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" drilling BHA from surface to 1;050'.

06/05/2014: Function tested BSR/CSR from Toolpusher's panel and Yellow Pod. Successfully pressure tested 16.04"/16.15" casing to 6;000 psi for 30 min. Successfully pressure tested BSR to 250/6;000 psi for 5 min; functioned from the Driller's panel; Yellow Pod. Tripped in hole with 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" drilling BHA from 1;050' to 7;333'. Made up Special BOP Test Tool (SBOPTT) into drill string and continued tripping in hole to 12;637'. Landed SBOPTT in wellhead at 5;297'. Successfully pressure tested BOPs to 250/8200 psi on 6-5/8" drill pipe; functioned from the Driller's panel; Blue Pod. Tripped out of hole from 12;637' to 12;557'.

06/06/2014: Tripped out of hole from 12;557' to 7;333' with 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" drilling BHA. Laid out SBOPTT. Tripped in hole from 7;333' to 18;849' with 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" drilling BHA. Function tested BOPs from Toolpusher's panel; Yellow Pod. Drilled 16.15" casing shoe track and rathole from 18;947' to 19;250'. Drilled new formation from 19;250' to 19;260'.

06/07/2014: Tripped out of hole from 19;260' to 19;093'. Performed leak off test to 2;117 psi; 14.6 ppg equivalent mud weight. Drilled 14-1/2" x 16-1/2" hole from 19;260' to 20;140'; starting in with 12.7 ppg SBM at 19;900'.
"},{"   ":14,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062101,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-06-08","TEXT_REMARK":"06/08/2014: Drilled ahead from 20;140' to 21;658' with 14.5" x 16.5" BHA. Increased mud weight from 12.7 to 13.0 ppg SBM at 20;908'.

06/09/2014: Drilled ahead from 21;658' to 21;954' with 14.5" x 16.5" BHA. Increased mud weight from 13.0 to 13.6 ppg SBM at 22;740'.

06/10/2014: Drilled ahead from 23;031' to 24;253' with 14.5" x 16.5" BHA. 

Note: Ivo Terziev (Chevron) received approval from Bobby Nelson (BSEE) to allow static downhole mud weight to be a minimum of 0.3 ppg below the 16" casing shoe LOT value or lowest estimated frac gradient. He stipulated that if hydrocarbons were found or the PWD fails; the approval would be removed and static downhole mud weight could not be more than 0.5 ppg below the 16" casing shoe LOT value or lowest estimated frac gradient.

06/11/2014: Drilled ahead from 24;253' to 25;040' with 14.5" x 16.5" BHA. Noticed splintered shale at 24;820'. Displaced well to 13.9 ppg SBM.

Note: Ivo Terziev requested an extension to function the BSRs/CSRs after reaching TD from Bobby Nelson.

06/12/2014: Tripped out of the hole from 25;040' to 5;573'. Pulled Dril-Quip wear sleeve to surface. Pulled 14.5" x 16.5" BHA to surface. Subsea: Function Tested Blind Shear Rams and Casing Shear Rams (BSRs/CSRs).

Note: Ivo Terziev notified Bobby Nelson that the decision was made to PPH for the BSR/CSR function test.

06/13/2014: Made up new 14.5" x 16.5" BHA without a mud motor. Tripped in the hole to 21;014'. Subsea: Function tested the Diverter from the Toolpusher's and Driller's panel. Function tested Blow Out Preventer (BOP) from Toolpusher's panel; Blue Pod.

06/14/2014: Tripped in the hole from 21;014' to 24;747'. Reamed previous pilot hole from 25;000' to 25;041'. Drilled ahead from 25;041' to 25;394'. At 25;394'; the rotary stalled and stuck the pipe 11 ft after a connection. Jarred one time to free pipe. Drilled from 25;394' to TD at 25;800'. Displaced the well to 14.1 ppg SBM while drilling the last two stands. Spotted a 16.5 ppg high weight slug in the pilot hole and circulated the hole clean with a 16.5 ppg weighted sweep. 
"},{"   ":15,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062101,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-06-15","TEXT_REMARK":"06/15/2014: Tripped out of the hole with 14.5" x 16.5" BHA to approximately 9;000'. Failure of a main draw works motor. Stabbed a safety valve and spaced out to work on the motor repairs.

06/16/2014: Removed damaged motor on the main draw works. Completed tripping out of the hole to surface and retrieved Dril-Quip wear sleeve.

06/17/2014: Replaced damaged motor in main draw works with a scavenged motor from the auxiliary draw works. Monitored well on the trip tank for losses. Lost 4 bbls over 24 hours.

06/18/2014: Completed repairs to primary draw works. 

Subsea: Began BOP pressure test on the choke and kill manifold. After draw works were repaired; tripped in the hole with Blow Out Preventer Test Tool (BOPTT). Landed BOPTT and set in wellhead. Began BOP pressure test to 250/6200 psi on the annulars; 250/8200 psi on rams and surface equipment with 14.1 ppg SBM. 

06/19/2014: Subsea: Completed BOP pressure test to 250/6200 psi on the annulars; 250/8200 psi on rams and surface equipment with 14.1 ppg SBM. Function tested BOPs from Driller's panel on the Yellow Pod. Functioned the diverter from the Driller's panel. Function tested the Blind and Casing Shear Rams (BSR/CSR) from Driller's panel on the Yellow Pod. Tripped out of the hole with BOP test tool. Rigged up casing equipment and began running 14"/14.15" casing.

06/20/2014: Ran in the hole with 14"/14.15" casing. Rigged down casing handling equipment and rigged up landing string handling equipment. Made up 14" Versaflex liner hanger and tripped in the hole with the landing string.

06/21/2014: Tripped in the hole 2 stands above planned shoe depth. Converted Allamon diverter and diverter test device. 14" hanger was prematurely set while attempting to convert the Allamon tools. Verified hanger set and completed setting procedure for assurance. Pulled hanger running tool out of the hanger. 14" liner prematurely set at 25;322' MD; continued running 14" liner."},{"   ":16,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062101,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-06-22","TEXT_REMARK":"06/22/2014: Release 14" Halliburton VersaFlex liner running tool. Tripped out of hole to surface. Inspected 14" Halliburton VersaFlex liner running tool and lay out same. 

06/23/2014: TIH with 12-1/4" Cleanout BHA. Set wear sleeve @ 5;300'. At 19;370'; tagged obstruction. Attempted to work through obstruction at 19;370' without success. Obstruction estimated to be wear sleeve stabilizer tagging 14" top of liner. Top of liner fell ~480 ft. Liner shoe estimated to be on bottom.

06/24/2014: Circulated bottoms. Performed injection test at 1 bpm until pressure broke over at 1;371 psi with 23 bbls pumped. TIH to 19;370'; tagging obstruction with 20k down. TOH to surface with 12-1/4" Cleanout BHA. Inspected BHA. TIH from surface to 8;799' with 12-1/4" Cleanout BHA on 6-5/8" DP.

06/25/2014: TIH with 12-1/4" Cleanout BHA from 8;799' to 25;672' (plugs on upper float collar) setting wear sleeve in wellhead at 5;300'. Drilled out 14" wiper plugs; upper and lower float collars. Tagged 14" liner shoe at 25;800'; confirming liner had fallen to bottom. Circulated bottoms up and TOH from 25;800' to 13;157'.

06/26/2014: TOH from 13;157' to 12;644' with 12-1/4" Cleanout BHA on 6-5/8" DP; retrieving wear sleeve from wellhead at 5;300'. Function tested BOPs on 6-5/8" DP from Driller's panel on Blue Pod. Function tested Diverter from Toolpusher's panel (29 sec. closed) and Driller's panel (30 sec. closed). Continued TOH from 12;644' to surface. Functioned tested BSR/CSR from Toolpusher's panel on the Yellow Pod. Tested acoustic communications. TIH with Dril-Quip NBP from surface to 6;420'.

06/27/2014: TIH with DQ NBP and set in wellhead. TOH with DQ MPT to surface. Rigged up SLB wireline equipment and tools. RIH with SLB 12.125" Max OD gauge ring logging assembly on .48" OD E-line from surface to 18;975' WL depth (~3' into 14" liner top). Logging tool stuck in 14" liner. Performed ECRD and left logging tool in hole; top of fish at ±18;942'. POOH with wireline only. 

06/28/2014: Made up overshot fishing assy on 6-5/8" HWDP stand and TIH from surface to 18;843'. Made up TDS. Recorded baseline parameters at 10 RPM and 2 BPM. Washed down while rotating from 18;843' to 18;974' with 10 RPM at 2 BPM with no indication of fish."},{"   ":17,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062101,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-06-29","TEXT_REMARK":"06/29/2014: TIH with 11-3/4" overshot and grapple fishing assembly from 18;974' to 25;535'. Made up TDS at 25;535' to record baseline parameters. Pressure built to 1;000 psi at 2 bpm. Bled off stand pipe and continued TIH from 25;535' with 10 rpm and no pump. Shut down rotary and set down 15k on top of fish at 25;777'. Pressured up to 3;700 psi to blow rupture disc. Pumped slug and TOH with fishing assembly from 25;777 to 2;689'.

06/30/2014: Continued TOH with 11-3/4" overshot and grapple fishing assembly with wireline fish from 2;689' to surface with full recovery of gauge ring/ junk basket fish. Performed BSR/CSR function test from Toolpusher's panel on Blue Pod. BSR closed in 32 sec with 38.9 gal; opened in 31 sec with 36.8 gal; high pressure 17 sec. CSR closed in 15 sec; opened in 31 sec with 36.2 gal. Rigged up wireline equipment. RIH with perforation guns on wireline. Correlated and perforated 14" liner from 25;692' to 25;697'. POOH from 25;697' and rigged down wireline equipment. Rigged up 14" casing equipment. Made up second trip packer seal assembly. RIH with 115.53 Q-125 HP SLSF with crossover joint and tieback receptacle to 138'.

07/01/2014: Rigged down 14" handling equipment and rigged up drill pipe elevators. Picked up 14" VersaFlex hanger and ran in hole from 138' to 193'; well giving proper displacement. Rigged down Frank's. Trip in hole with second run packer from 193' to 18;948'. Continued running to 18;973'; pumping 1.5 bpm. Saw pump pressure increase. Shut down pump and engaged ratch-latch. Rigged up Black Hawk; tested lines; and tested back side to 500 psi; good test. Dropped VersaFlex setting ball.

07/02/2014: Continued to let VersaFlex liner hanger setting ball fall to seat. Set top of 14' hanger @ 18;823'. POOH with hanger running tool from 18;808' to 10;079' while performing benchmark tests with IPT. Made up double dutch stand. Tested BOPs; Upper and lower annular to 250 low/6;200 high; tested rams 1; 2; 3 and surface equipment to 250 low/ 8;200 high; and kelly hose to 250 low/ 6;500 high. 17 of 17 tests completed at midnight. 

07/03/2014: Function tested BOPs from Toolpusher's panel; Yellow Pod. Function tested diverter from Toolpusher's panel and Driller's panel. TOH with VersaFlex running tool from 10;079' to 580'. Changed out handling equipment. TOH with VersaFlex running tool from 580' to surface. TIH with 14" FasDrill to 12;329'.

07/04/2014: TIH with 14" FasDrill from 12;329' to 22;733'. A & B electrical drives shut down troubleshoot and repaired same. TIH to 22;990'. Proximity switch on main draw works failed; replaced same. TIH to FasDrill setting depth of 25;557'.

07/05/2014: At 25;557'. set Fas Drill. Un-sting and pump down drill pipe to test FasDrill seal and seal assembly to 3;000 psi for 5 min; good test. Rigged up and performed cement squeeze job. Pumped 150 bbls lead spacer; 416 bbls/ 2;336 cu ft/ 2;204 sacks cement; and 30 bbl tail spacer. POOH wet from 25;557' to 25;006'. Circulated bottoms up. Slugged pipe; TOH to 18;823'. Spotted Hi Vis pill on top of 14" TOL. TOH to 13;483'.

Note: Ivo Terziev (Chevron) received 24 hour extention for BSR/casing test from Bobby Nelson (BSEE).
"},{"   ":18,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062101,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-07-06","TEXT_REMARK":"07/06/2014: Tripped out of the hole with FasDrill setting tool. Began removal of the main drawworks B motor. Subsea: Function tested Blind and Casing Shear Rams (BSRs/CSRs) from the Driller's panel; Yellow Pod. Pressure tested BSR; 16" casing and 14" liner to 256/4400 psi for 30 minutes with 14.1 ppg SBM.

Dual Gradient: Attempted to pump with MLP. The mud valves were sticky and the test was aborted.

07/07/2014: Continued replacement of the main drawworks B motor.

Dual Gradient: Attempted to flush mud inlet valves. Displaced 14.1 ppg SBM in the choke and MRL to 8.6 ppg riser fluid. Unable to flush valves with 500 gpm and 600 psi. Displaced 8.6 ppg riser fluid in the choke line and MRL to 14.1 ppg SBM.

07/08/2014: Completed change out of the main drawworks B motor. Tripped in the hole to retrieve the Nominal Bore Protector (NBP). Tripped out of the hole with the NBP and prepared to run 13-7/5" x 14" tieback. Subsea: Function tested BOPs from the Toolpusher's panel with the Blue Pod. Function tested the diverter from the Toolpusher's and Driller's panel.

07/09/2014: Rigged up Frank's casing equipment. Ran 13-3/4"; 98.58 ppf; Q-125HP; SLIJ-II; to 3;997'. Ran 14"; 115.53 ppf; Q-125HP; SLSF to 4;713'. Ran 13-3/4"; 98.58ppf; Q-125HP; SLIJ-II to 5;531'. Subsea: Function tested Blind and Casing Shear Rams (BSRs/CSRs) from the Driller's panel on the Blue Pod.

07/10/2014: Continued running 13-3/4"; 98.58 ppf; Q-125HP; SLIJ-II to 6;843'. Ran 14"; 115.53 ppf; Q-125HP; SLSF to 13;361'. Rigged down Frank's handling equipment.

Note: BSEE Inspection. Mr. Cedric Bernard; Mr. James Richardson; and Mr. Cemal Ozoral performed an inspection. No INCs were issued.

07/11/2014: Picked up Dril-Quip 14" casing hanger and made up to casing string. Backed out the hanger running tool. Ran 13;163' of 3-1/2" inner string. Made up casing hanger seal assembly running tool. Tripped in the hole with landing string to 16;713'

07/12/2014: Landed out the 13-3/4" x 14" tieback at 18;672'. Circulated and conditioned mud. Pumped 170 bbls 12.2 ppg lead spacer; 206 bbls of 16.4 ppg cement; and 15 bbls of tail spacer. Displaced with synthetic based mud from the rig pumps. Began waiting on cement (WOC).
"},{"   ":19,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062101,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-07-13","TEXT_REMARK":"07/13/2014: Finished WOC for the 13.75" x 14" tieback cement job. Attempted to set seal assembly on Dril-Quip 14" x 18-3/4" casing hanger by shutting middle pipe ram #2 and pressuring up to 10 klbs. Pressure broke over before reaching 10 klbs. Pulled the casing hanger seal assembly running tool to surface and found the seal assembly had not been set. Also; the outer split lock ring on the seal assembly was left in the hole. Pulled the 3-1/2" inner string out of the hole.

07/14/2014: Tripped in the hole with an 11.5" flat bottom magnet BHA. Attempted to tag top of 14" x 18-3/4" casing hanger. Ran down to 5;311' and did not notice any parameter changes. Tripped out of the hole to surface and inspected 11.5" magnet. Recovered 1.2 oz of metal. 
Subsea: Function tested BSRs/CSRs from the Toolpusher's panel on the Yellow Pod. Function tested the diverters from the Driller's and Toolpusher's panel. Function tested the BOPs from the Driller's panel on the Yellow Pod. Tested BOP acoustic communications.

07/15/2014: Made up 16" flat bottom magnet BHA. Tagged the wellhead 176' deep at 5;476'. Retested middle pipe ram #2 with the test rams to 8;200 psi unsuccessfully. Pulled 16" flat bottom magnet to surface. Ran in the hole with BOP Test Tool and landed out in first position casing hanger.

07/16/2014: Completed BOP testing as written below. Pulled out of the hole with BOP Test Tool. Ran the Dril-Quip Nominal Bore Protector in the hole.
Subsea: BOP pressure test from the Driller's panel on the Yellow Pod. Tested 6-5/8" drill pipe with 14.1 ppg synthetic based mud to 250/8;200 psi with the rams and 250/6;200 psi with the annulars. Functioned tested BOPs from the Driller's panel on the Blue Pod. Function tested diverter from the Driller's and Toolpusher's panels.

07/17/2014: Pulled the Nominal Bore Protector running tool out of the hole. Made up a 12.25" cleanout BHA and ran in the hole down to 18;818'. Drilled firm cement to 18;825'. Unable to drill further. 

07/18/2014: Pulled the 12.25" cleanout BHA out of the hole. Tested Blind Shear Rams and 14" casing successfully to 250/4;400 psi.

07/19/2014: Made up a 12.25" milling assembly BHA. Ran in the hole with milling assembly and set weight down at 18;822'. Milled down to 18;824.5'.
Subsea: Function tested Blind and Casing Shear Rams from the Toolpusher's panel with the Blue Pod.
"},{"   ":20,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062101,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-07-20","TEXT_REMARK":"07/20/2014: Continued milling obstruction at 14" liner top to 18;826'. Tripped out of hole to surface. Once at surface; pressure tested casing to 4;400 psi for 30 minutes; good. 

07/21/2014: Tripped in hole with 13-3/8" Halliburton EZSV and set with top of packer at 18;486'; then sheared out of EZSV#1. Tested top of packer to 1;000 psi; good. Pumped a 100 bbl weighted sweep and circulated bottoms up with 14.4 ppg at 18;476'.

07/22/2014: Tripped out of hole with EZSV#1 running tool from 18;478' to surface. Made up and tripped in hole with 5-7/8" cement stinger to 16;719'.

07/23/2014: Continued to trip in hole with cement stinger from 16;719' to 18;472'. Negative tested 13-3/8" EZSV#1 to 1;710 psi (equivalent seawater gradient); good. Spotted a 500' 16.4 ppg Class H balanced cement plug #1 on top of EZSV#1 from 18;746' to estimated top of cement at 17;976'. Tripped out of hole from 18;476' to 11;000'. Displaced well from 14.1 to 13.0 ppg at 11;000'. Function tested BOPs from the Toolpusher's panel from the Yellow Pod. Function tested Diverter from the Driller's and Toolpusher's panels; 22 seconds from Driller's panel and 23 seconds from Toolpusher's panel.

07/24/2014: Finished displacing well with 13.0 ppg SBM from 11;000' to surface. Trip out of the hole with 5-7/8" cement stinger from 11;000' to surface. Tripped in hole with 13-5/8" Archer packer and set at 5;780'; tail pipe at 6;313'. Tested packer from below against cement plug to 4;000 psi; good. Rigged up wireline through the top drive using the Top Entry Assess System. Tested pack off to 2;000; good. 

07/25/2014: Ran in hole with Schlumberger 1.7" casing punch perforation guns to 11;010'. Applied 300 psi on drill pipe then fired guns inside 14" casing from 11;000' to 11;010'; 6 shots per ft. No observed change in drill pipe pressure or change in trip tank. Attempted to break circulation with rig pumps; no success. Pull out of hole and rigged down wireline; confirmed 100% of shots fired. Pressured up drill pipe to 4;000 psi to attempt to establish circulation through packer and perforations up the 14" by 16" annulus; unable to circulate. Packer and 14" casing below packer held 4;000 psi. 

Ran in hole with second set of Schlumberger 1.7" casing punch perforation guns to 11;010'. Applied 300 psi on the drill pipe then fired guns inside 14" casing from 11;000' to 11;006'; 6 shots per ft. No observed change in drill pipe pressure or change in trip tank. Attempted to break circulation with rig pumps; no success. Pulled out of hole and rig down wireline; confirmed 100% of shots fired. Pressured up drill pipe to 4;000 psi to attempt to establish circulation through packer and perforations up the 14" by 16" annulus; unable to circulate; packer and 14" casing below packer held 4;000 psi. 

Unset packer; rigged down the Top Entry Assess System and wireline equipment. Pulled out of hole with the packer from 6;304' to 5;962'.

07/26/2014: Continued to trip out of hole with packer to surface. Ran in hole with Schlumberger 4.7" perforation guns and perforated from 11;000 to 11;003'; 12 shots per ft. Pulled out of hole with wireline. Closed blind shear rams and attempted to establish injection rates. Pressured up to 1;200 psi and held for 15 minutes. Made up 13-5/8" Archer packer; tripped in hole and set packer at 5;908' and attempted to circulate through 14" x 16" annulus. Pressured up to 1;200 psi and held for 15 minutes. Unable to circulate. Unset packer and tripped out of hole.
"},{"   ":21,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062101,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-07-27","TEXT_REMARK":"07/27/2014: Tripped out of the hole with the 13-5/8" retrievable Archer packer from 5;578' to surface. Ran in the hole with a 13-3/4" Halliburton EZSV bridge plug and set at 10;920'. Tested on top of EZSV bridge plug to 1;500 psi for 15 minutes; good. Spotted a 500' cement plug (75 bbls of 16.4 ppg Class H with 35% silica flour) on top of EZSV from 10;920' to 10;420'.

07/28/2014: Tripped out of the hole with the EZSV bridge plug running tool. Tripped in the hole with a 13-5/8" Archer packer and set at 6;158'; with 6-5/8" tail pipe at 6;185'. Successfully pressure tested the wellbore between the packer at 6;158' and cement plug at 10;420' to 1;200 psi with 13.0 ppg SBM for 15 minutes. Unset Archer packer and tripped out of the hole; leaving the Archer packer at 5;652'. 

Ran in the hole with 1.71" Schlumberger casing perforation guns on wireline through drill pipe to 9;006'. Perforated the 14" Q-125HP 115# casing from 9;000' to 9;006'; (0 deg phasing; 31 shots; 6 shots per foot). Monitored the well and pulled out of the hole with wireline to surface. Reset the Archer packer at 5;652' and established circulation through the perforations up the 14" x 16" annulus. Circulated bottoms up with 13.0 ppg SBM at 1.0 to 1.6 bbl/min with 1;400 to 2;000 psi surface circulating pressure. Unset Archer packer. Rigged up wireline equipment and ran in hole with 1.71" Schlumberger casing perforation guns to add additional perforations to attempt to improve circulation.

07/29/2014: Continued to run in hole with 1.71" Schlumberger casing perforation guns on wireline through drill pipe to 9;006'. Perforated 14" Q-125HP 115# casing for a second time from 9;000' to 9;006' (0 deg phasing; 31 shots; 6 shots per foot.) Monitored the well and pulled out of the hole with wireline to surface. Reset Archer packer at 5;652' and re-established circulation through the perforations up the 14" x 16" annulus. Circulated bottoms up with 13.0 ppg SBM at 1.5 to 1.6 bbl/min with 1;980 to 2;050 psi surface circulating pressure. Unset Archer packer and pulled out of the hole to surface. 

Tripped in hole and set a 13-3/4" Halliburton EZSV cement retainer at 8;493'. Pumped 120 bbls of 16.4 ppg Class H with 35% silica flour below the EZSV; through the perforations; and up the 14" x 16" annulus (75 bbls left in the 14" casing; leaving a 507' plug below the EZSV and 45 bbls squeezed through perforations at 9;000' and up the 14" x 16" annulus). Estimated top of cement in the 14" x 16" annulus at 7;000'. 

07/30/2014: Tripped out of the hole to 8;483'. Spotted a 500' cement plug (75 bbls 16.4 ppg Class H with 35% silica flour) on top of the EZSV from 8;483' to 7;983'. Tripped out of the hole with the EZSV running tool to surface. Tripped in hole with the Dril-Quip Multi-Purpose Tool (MPT) to retrieve the nominal bore protector (NBP) at 5;458'. Pulled out of the hole with the MPT and NBT to surface. Tripped in the hole with riser brushes and diverter sub to 1;264'.

Note: Gust Woldtvedt (Chevron) received approval from Bobby Nelson (BSEE) to discontine BOP pressure test; BOP function test; diverter function test; and casing pressure test due to wellbore barriers being in place.

07/31/2014: Continued to trip in the hole with riser brushes and diverter sub to 5;623'. Successfully pressure tested wellbore to 1;500 psi with 13.0 ppg mud for 30 min. Tripped up the hole leaving diverter sub at 5;676'. Successfully negative tested the wellbore to 1;385 psi (equivalentsea water gradient). The test pressure was bled to 0 psi with no flow for 1 hour. 

08/01/2014: Displaced wellbore; riser; choke; kill; and mud return line from 13.0 ppg SBM to seawater from 5;676' to surface. Spotted a 314' surface cement plug (70 bbls 16.6 ppg Class H with 35% silica flour) from 5;676' to 5;362'. Spotted 50 bbls of treated seawater (corrosion inhibitor and oxygen scavenger) from the top of cement at 5;362' to the high pressure wellhead housing at 5;295'.

08/02/2014: Tripped in hole with the mud lift pump bearing latch assembly (BLA) to 5;234' and successfully latched into the BLA profile and released. Tripped out of the hole with the BLA to surface. Prepared surface equipment to pull riser.
"},{"   ":22,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062101,"WAR_START_DT":"2014-08-03","TEXT_REMARK":"08/03/2014: Disconnected the Mud Lift Pump / Lower Marine Riser Package (MLP/LMRP) from the wellhead. Laid out the telescopic joint and pulled 23 of 53 joints of riser.

08/04/2014: Pulled the remaining joints of riser and MLP/LMRP to the splash zone.  Removed cables form the Mud Lift Pump and landed the MLP/LMRP on the BOP transporter. Removed the bolts between the Solids Processing Unit (SPU) and MLP and disconnected the control lines. Laid down the Subsea Rotating Device (SRD) joint.

08/05/2014: Laid down the SPU. Jetted the MLP and LMRP with seawater. Transported MLP/LMRP to the aft moonpool. Ran down to the BOP with the Drill Pipe Running and Retrieval Tool (DPRRT). Subsea: Separated the MLP and LMRP to their respective setback areas.

08/06/2014: Unlatched the BOP and moved rig away from the wellhead. Pulled the BOP on drill pipe to the surface; and jetted with seawater. Installed TA cap and pumped preservation fluid into the TA cap and wellhead.
	
"},{"   ":23,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062101,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-05-15","TEXT_REMARK":"05/15/2015: Continue between well work. Began making equipment preparations to retrieve Anchor 1 wellhead.

05/16/2015: Continue between well work. Tripped in with a Diamond Wire Saw on drill pipe to retrieve Anchor 1 wellhead."},{"   ":24,"WELL_NAME":"  001","API12":608114062101,"WAR_START_DT":"2015-05-17","TEXT_REMARK":"05/17/2015: Tripped in from 4;006' to 5;285'. Landed diamond wire saw on Anchor #1 wellhead. Removed rigging between diamond wire saw and drill pipe; disconnected from saw; and tripped out to 5;150'. Moved rig 500' off of Anchor #1 location. ROV attempted to function test the diamond wire saw with no success. Recovered diamond wire saw from wellhead. Recovered diamond wire saw and tripped out from 5;285' to surface for repairs.

05/18/2015: Tripped in from surface to 5;285'. Attached diamond wire saw to Anchor #1 wellhead and function tested saw. Removed rigging between diamond wire saw and drill pipe and disconnected saw from drill pipe. Tripped out from 5;285' to surface. Tripped in from surface to 5;285' with wellhead retrieval tool (WHRT). Engaged WHRT in Anchor #1 wellhead. Began cutting wellhead with diamond wire saw and ROV.

05/19/2015: Finished cutting off Anchor #1 wellhead with diamond wire saw and ROV. Tripped out from 5;285' to surface with Anchor #1 wellhead. Recovered 8' of the wellhead; leaving 7' of stick up above the mud line. Top of Anchor #1 well now at 5;303'. Tripped in from surface to 5;285' and retrieved diamond wire saw. Tripped out from 5;285' to surface with diamond wire saw. 
"},{"   ":25,"WELL_NAME":"  001a","API12":608114066100,"WAR_START_DT":"2016-01-24","TEXT_REMARK":"01/24/2016: Completed between well maintenance. Rigged up to run 36" casing and Low Pressure Wellhead Housing (LPWH). Ran 36" casing; Low Pressure Wellhead Housing and 30" jet-in assembly.

Note: Ms. Amanda Pena (Chevron) received approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) via email on 01/24/2016 at 15:11 hrs to proceed with steps 1-4 of the drilling procedure for the Anchor 3 well.

01/25/2016: Installed ROV valves and slope indicators on LPWH. Tripped in open water with LPWH; 36" casing and 30" jet-in assembly to 500' above mud line. Moved vessel to Anchor 3 well center and jetted in 36" casing to 5;120' and let soak while watching for subsidence. Top of LPWH at 4;803' MD. Released from wellhead and tripped out of 36" casing with 30" BHA. Tripped out to 4;630' MD/TVD and moved vessel away from Anchor 3 well center. Current MW is 8.6 ppg SW.

01/26/2016: Pull out to surface with 36" running tool and 30" jetting BHA and lay down same. M/U 26" drilling BHA and RIH from surface to 4;583' MD/TVD. Move vessel to Anchor 3 well center. Continue running 26" drilling BHA in open water to LPWH at 4;803' MD. Lower 26" BHA into LPWH with ROV assist; and continue running in hole from 4;800' MD to 5;096' MD. Wash down drilling assembly from 5;096' MD to 5;120' MD. Drill from 5;120' MD to 5;258' MD with seawater. Displace well to 10.1 ppg water-based mud (WBM) at 5;258' MD. Continue drilling from 5;258' MD to 5;652' MD with 10.1 ppg WBM. Confirm top of salt at 5;565' MD. Current MW is 10.1 ppg WBM.

01/27/2016: Continue drilling 26" hole section from 5;652' MD to TD at 6;550' MD. Pump 200 bbl 12.5 ppg sweep at TD. Spot 33 bbl 16.0 ppg WBM from 6;550' MD to 6;500' MDD. Displace well from 10.1 ppg to 13.0 ppg WBM. Trip out of hole from 6;500' MD to 4;840' MD. Drop dart and activate circulation sub. Trip in hole with 26" drilling assembly from 4;840' MD to 5;050' MD and wash LPWH with circulation sub. Trip out of hole with 26" drilling assembly from 5;050' MD to surface. Rig up 22" casing running equipment. Current MW is 13.0 ppg WBM.

01/28/2016: Begin running 22" x 23" casing from surface to 1;660' MD in open water. M/U High Pressure Wellhead Housing (HPWH) to 23" casing and run inner string from surface to 1;561' MD. M/U MRLD to HPWH and lower to moon pool. Run 22" casing on landing string from 1;660' MD to 4;600' MD. Move vessel from safe handling zone to Anchor 3 well center. Continue running casing from 4;600' MD to 4;800' MD and stab casing into LPWH to 4;832' MD. Displace landing string to 13.0 ppg WBM. Continue running in hole with casing from 4;832' MD to 6;517' MD. Land out MRLD tool in LPWH at 4;803' MD and slack off to 550;000 lbs to lock HPWH into LPWH. Rig up lines for cementing. Current MW is 13.0 ppg WBM.

01/29/2016: Continue rigging up cement lines and circulate bottoms up with 13.0 ppg WBM. Perform 23" x 22" cement job. Pumped 200 bbls 15.4 ppg spacer foamed to 238 bbls of 13.3 ppg foamed spacer with nitrogen unit. Mix and pump 688 bbls/3;863 cu ft 16.2 ppg surface cement foamed to 825 bbls/ 4;632 cu ft 13.8 ppg lead cement slurry taking returns to the mud line. Mix and pump 178 bbls/ 999 cu ft 16.2 ppg un-foamed tail cement slurry. Cement returns confirmed at mudline with ROV. Displace lines with 4 bbls seawater and launch nerf ball. Displace cement with 204 bbls seawater. Total cement pumped 1003 bbls/ 5;631 cu ft. R/D cement lines and nitrogen manifold. Pre-load and release from HPWH. Pull out of hole from 6;367' MD to 5;930' MDD; pump down nerf ball and displace well to 13.0 ppg WBM. Continue tripping out of hole from 5;930' MD to 4;521' MD. Move vessel to safe zone and continue tripping out in open water from 4;521' MD to 1;573' MD and L/D wellhead running tool. Continue tripping out in open water from 1;573' MD to surface. Begin rigging up to run riser. Current MW is 13.0 ppg WBM.

01/30/2016: Pick up 90' riser joint and skid BOP to well center. Make up BOP to 90' riser joint and splash BOP to 193' MD. Install BOP test stabs and pressure test choke and kill lines. Good test. Pressure test rigid conduit and boost lines. Good test. Run BOP on marine riser from 193' MD to 2;443' MD. Install test cap and test choke; kill; rigid conduit and boost lines. Good test. Current MW in cased hole is 13.0 ppg WBM.
"},{"   ":26,"WELL_NAME":"  001a","API12":608114066100,"WAR_START_DT":"2016-01-31","TEXT_REMARK":"01/31/2016: Pressure test Conduit and Boost lines; good test. Run BOP #2 on marine riser from 2;443' MD to 4;468' MD while installing seals and mux line clamps. Fill up choke; kill; boost and rigid conduits and install test caps. Successfully pressure tested choke/kill lines; mud boost; and conduit lines. Pick up telescopic joint and lock into MRT ring. Successfully pressure test choke/kill lines and boost/conduit lines. Move rig from DOZ to well center and adjust tensioner pressure in preparation for latching BOPs. BOP officially latched up at 23:30 hrs. Current MW is 13.0 ppg WBM in well; 8.6 ppg seawater in riser.

02/01/2016: Transfer weight of BOP and marine riser to MRT. Perform connector test successfully to 2;500 psi. L/D riser handling equipment and install diverter. Troubleshoot supply regulator issue on Blue Pod. Pick up BOP Test Tool and Dual-Cam tool and run in hole from surface to 759' MD . Perform diverter function test from Driller's panel. Continue running Dual-Cam tool in hole from 759' MD to 5;423' MD. R/U lines to double dutch assembly and pressure test lines to 12;200 psi. Good test observed. Current MW is 13.0 ppg WBM in well; 8.6 ppg seawater in riser.

02/02/2016: Pressure test BOP on 6-5/8" drill pipe from Driller's Panel; Yellow Pod; with 8.6 ppg seawater. Completed IPT tests 21 and 22. Performed BOP accumulator draw down test from Yellow Pod on Driller's Panel. Good test. Surface equipment issues lead to bad pressure tests. Troubleshoot surface leak and remedy situation. Continue pressure testing BOP. Successfully completed IPT test 26. Discover leak on IBOP and swap it out. Continue pressure testing BOP and successfully complete IPT test #27. Current MW is 13.0 ppg WBM in well; 8.6 ppg seawater in riser.

02/03/2016: Troubleshoot lower IBOP on top drive not testing. Isolated lower IBOP and continue to test BOP per IPT tests 27 and 28. Rigged down test lines; tripped in hole to 200' MD below the wellhead (5;000' MD) and displace 13.0 ppg WBM out of wellhead. POOH to wash wellhead; then TIH to 5;569' MD (Test Tool depth 4;805' MD) and land out BOPTT. Close lower pipe ram and pressure test wellhead connection to 250 psi low/ 12;550 psi high for 5 minutes with 8.6 ppg seawater. Good test. Back out of Dual-Cam tool and pressure test BOP per IPT test 29. Troubleshoot surface equipment leaks. Current MW is 13.0 ppg below wellhead and 8.6 ppg in riser. 

Note: Mr. Matthew Nelson (Chevron) notified Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) on 02/02/2016 regarding a malfunction on the Blue POD 5K to 3K regulator that was noticed after initial BOP latch up and diverter testing. Through troubleshooting efforts; we determined that by placing the Acoustic Non-Shear Accumulator Supply and LMRP Accumulator Supply functions in block; the regulator performed as designed; outputting 3;000 psi. On 02/03/2016; Mr. Bobby Nelson granted Mr. Matthew Nelson approval to proceed with permitted operations with the Acoustic Non-Shear Accumulator Supply and LMRP Accumulator Supply functions in block.

02/04/2016: Pressure test from Driller's Panel; Yellow Pod; per IPT test 34. Discovered leak in surface lines and attempted to troubleshoot. Completed BOP testing by pressure testing BSR from Driller's Panel; Yellow Pod; with 8.6 ppg seawater per IPT test 34. Re-engaged Dual-Cam tool and BOPTT. Tripped out of hole from 5;569' MD to surface. Continued pressure testing BSR and casing to 3;500 psi for 30 min; followed by IBOP pressure testing. Good tests. Pick up and make up 18-1/8" x 21" BHA. Begin choke manifold pressure testing. Current MW is 13.0 ppg below wellhead and 8.6 ppg in riser. 

02/05/2016: RIH with 18-1/8" x 21" drilling assembly from 2;418' MD to 4;724' MD. Continue troubleshooting and pressure testing choke and kill manifold. Continue RIH to 5;344'. Displace from seawater to 11.2 ppg SBM. Took SCRs and perform choke drill. Current MW is 11.2 ppg SBM.

02/06/2016: Perform choke drill with drill crew. Wash from 6;390' MD to 6;415' MD . Drill cement and shoe at 6;516' MD . Suspended operations due to DP yellow event caused by loss of thruster 3 while thruster 2 was in maintenance mode. Wash and ream rathole from 6;516' MD to 6;550' MD . Drill new formation from 6;550' MD to 6;560' MD. Pump sweep and circulate cuttings above BOP. Position bit inside 22" shoe and perform FIT to 815 psi surface pressure and 13.6 ppg EMW; 13.83 ppg downhole. Wash back to 6;560' MD. Drill 18-1/8" hole to 6;657' MD . Activate 21" reamer and ream back to 6;657' MD. Drill 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 6;657' MD to 7;672' MD . Current MW is 11.2 ppg SBM.
"},{"   ":27,"WELL_NAME":"  001a","API12":608114066100,"WAR_START_DT":"2016-02-07","TEXT_REMARK":"02/07/2016: Drilled 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 7;672' to 9;819' on 6-5/8" drill pipe. Mud weight (MW) in hole was 12.0 ppg at 9;819'.

02/08/2016: Drilled 18-1/8 " x 21" hole section from 9;819' to 10;383' and weighted up mud to 12.4 ppg. Encountered lost returns at 10;383' MD with 12.4 ppg MW in hole - P/U 20 ft and shut in on annular. Allow base oil to take down the choke line to establish balance point - calculated EMW of 11.8 ppg to make well static. Displaced 6.6 ppg base oil into riser to decrease equivalent mud weight to 11.8 ppg. Attempted to move pipe without success. Worked/Jarred pipe until pipe became free. Tripped out of hole (TOH) from 10;383' to 9;600'. Displaced 12.4 ppg SBM in well with 11.5 ppg SBM - 80% returns while circulating until riser cap circulated out of well - % returns reduced when riser cap was circulated out. Shut in on annular and displace remaining 6.6 ppg base oil out of riser with 12.4 ppg SBM.

02/09/2016: Line up on 6.9 ppg base oil to spot new riser cap. Monitored well on trip tank - well static. Displaced 12.4 ppg SBM below BOPs with 11.5 ppg SBM - no losses. Flow checked well - no losses. Displaced choke; kill and boost line with 11.5 ppg SBM. Monitor well on choke line; observed 2 bbls/min losses. Tripped in hole (TIH) with 18-1/8" x 21" assembly from 9;600' to 10;060' and spot LCM pill. TOH from 10;060' to 9;545'. Pump bottoms up with 11.5 ppg SBM. Flow checked and observed 12 bbls/hr losses. Lined up and boosted riser volume. Monitor well through choke line; observed 6.2 bbl gain in 5 min. Shut in well. Monitored well with choke closed. No pressure build up observed. Monitor on open choke; watched flow rate decrease from 0.9 bbls/min to 0.3 bbls/min. 

02/10/2016: Monitored well on trip tank for 8.4 bbl/min gain; total 6 bbls gain. Closed annular. Spotted 67 bbls 16.0 ppg SBM in riser. Monitored well on trip tank with 0.5 bbl/min loss. TOH from 9;600' to 6;450' with 18-1/8" x 21" assembly. Monitored well - static. TOH from 6;450' to 6;077. TOH from 6;077' to surface. Displace 16.0 ppg SBM in riser with 11.5 ppg SBM. Flow checked well - well static. TIH with 18-1/8" x 21" drilling assembly from surface to 626'. Function tested BOP from Toolpusher's Panel; Yellow Pod - successful test. Function tested diverter from Driller's Panel - successful test. Function tested BSR and CSR from Toolpusher's Panel; Yellow Pod - successful test.

02/11/2016: TIH with 18-1/8" x 21" assembly from 626' to 10;060'. Washed and reamed from 10;040' to 10;383'. Drill 18-1/8" x 21" hole section from 10;383' to 11;249' with 11.5 ppg MW. 

02/12/2016: Circulate 3 bottoms up. Flow checked well - ballooning at 1 bbl/min which reduced to 0.2 bbl/min. Spotted 67 bbls of 16.0 ppg SBM in riser for trip out. Monitored well on trip tank; 0.6 bbl/min losses. Displaced 16.0 ppg SBM in riser with 11.5 ppg. Monitor well on trip tank - ballooning at 0.1 bbl/min. Spotted 34 bbls of 16.0 ppg in riser. Open annular monitor well on trip tank - loss rate 0.6 bbl/hour. Reamed out hole from 11;179' to 8;824' with 18-1/8" x 21" assembly due to tight spots encountered.

02/13/2016: Reamed out hole from 8;824' to 7;050' with 18-1/8" x 21" with no drag. TOH from 7;050' to 6;516'. TIH from 6;516' to 10;168' - tight spots encountered in suture 3. Washed and reamed from 10;168' to 11;210' - working through tight spots. Flow checked well - well static. TOH from 11;210' to 10;083' - no drag when tripping through suture. Flow checked well - well static. TIH from 10;083' to 11;205' - no drag while tripping back through suture. TOH from 11;205' to 10;080'. Flow checked well - well static. TOH from 10;080' to 9;660'. Flow checked well - slight ballooning encountered. Spotted 34 bbls of 16.0 ppg in riser for trip out.
"},{"   ":28,"WELL_NAME":"  001a","API12":608114066100,"WAR_START_DT":"2016-02-14","TEXT_REMARK":"02/14/2016: With well shut in; flow check through gas bleed valves; hole taking 12 bbls/hr. Opened the annular and monitored with same loss rates. Tripped out of the hole from 9;660' to 6;152'. Flow checked with 0.2 bbls/min loss rate and TOH from 6;152' to surface. Washed the 18" SA and wellhead with the Churchhill sub diverter. Rigged up and ran 18" casing from surface to 1;340'; well taking 8 bbls/hr.

Note: Mr. Steven Scruggs (Chevron) received verbal approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (Houma BSEE) via email on 02/14/2016 at 10:04 hrs to proceed with setting 18" casing 200' deeper than originally planned.

02/15/2016: Picked up and ran in hole with 17-7/8" x 18" casing from 1;340' to 5;062' - well static when not running pipe; losing 2 bbls/double when running pipe. Function tested BSR/CSR from Driller's Panel; Blue Pod; prior to crossing the BOP. Rigged down the casing handling equipment and rig up 6.625" drill pipe handling equipment. Running in hole with 6.625" inner string from surface to 4;908'. Made up the 18" hanger and RIH with the 18" casing on landing string from 5;062' to 10;152'. Set down weight at 10;152'; worked and pumped 18" casing down to 10;175'. Made several attempts with no success to wash pipe down; decision made to pull 17-7/8" x 18" casing out the hole. Monitored the well on trip tank; well ballooning at 0.5 bbls/min. Spotted 67 bbls of 16.0 ppg riser cap to control ballooning.

02/16/2016: Continued spotting 67 bbls riser cap to control ballooning; 25 bbl/hr losses. Spotted 34 bbls of riser cap to control losses; 12 bbl/min losses. Performed flow check and began pumping out of the hole with 17-7/8" x 18" casing from 10;167' to 5;104' while monitoring losses on the active system. With 18" hanger at surface; removed Dril-Quip running tool and pulling inner string from 4;908' to surface. Rigged up casing handling equipment and pulled 17-7/8" x 18" casing from 5;104' to 4;982'. 

02/17/2016: Pulled out of the hole with 17-7/8" x 18.0" casing to surface. Rigged casing handling equipment and boosted slug out of riser with BSR closed. Monitor well on Mini T/T. Tripped in hole with stinger to 6;127'. Function tested BOPs from the Driller's Panel; Blue Pod; and the Diverter from the Toolpusher's Panel; Performed Diverter function test from Toolpusher's panel. Continued to trip in hole to 10;060' and circulate bottoms up.

Note: Mr. William Averill (Chevron) notified Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) of a leak coming from what was believed to be the CSR operator. He informed Mr. Nelson that we were troubleshooting and would update BSEE once a plan forward was developed.

02/18/2016: Continued to circulate bottoms up. Pumped 120 bbls 11.5 ppg LCM pill at 10;060'; spotted and pulled out of pill to 9;200'. Lined up Halliburton cementers to pump down choke line and squeezed LCM pill. Squeezed away 152 bbls without any pressure response; indicating LCM was effective. Decision was made to rig up cement lines and prepare to spot balanced plug to squeeze away cement into loss zone. Spot balanced cement plug from 10;060' to 9;260' and POOH to 9;000' and circulate nerf ball with one tubing volume. R/D from cement job and pump slug and POOH to BOPs. Well static after cement plug spotted. Tested the BOPs from the Toolpusher's Panel; Blue Pod.

02/19/2016: Complete pressure testing BOPs from the Toolpusher's Panel; Blue Pod: 250 psi low/ 5300 psi high; successful tests. Pulled out of hole with wear sleeve and jetting assembly. Made up the Dual Cam BOPTT assembly and tripped in hole to 5;282' bit depth and landed the test plug at 4;805'. Performed PDC BOP #2 EHBS test sequence per procedure.

02/20/2016: Finished testing EHBS test as per PDC procedure. Pumped a slug and pulled out of hole and layed down Dual Cam tool. Boost slug out of riser while picking up mule shoe. Tripped in hole to interrogate cement plug that was spotted as a LCM squeeze. Plug tagged at 9;271'. At this point; it appeared losses had been in suture 1 up the hole. Circulated bottoms up to get cement spacer out of the hole. Losses encountered while CBU. Pulled out of hole to 8;452' and spotted a 14 ppg Hi-Vis pill; lost 62 bbls. Pulled out of hole to 8;150' and rigged up to perform cement job. 

Note: Mr. Steven Scruggs (Chevron) received verbal approval from Mr. Bobby Nelson (BSEE) via email on 02/20/2016 at 10:55 hrs to proceed with revised cement plugback plan to set plugs higher in the hole.

Note: Mr. Cole Joines (Chevron) submitted results of successful EHBS test to Mr. Fred Brink and Mr. Bobby Nelson of BSEE.
"},{"   ":29,"WELL_NAME":"  001a","API12":608114066100,"WAR_START_DT":"2016-02-21","TEXT_REMARK":"02/21/2016: Displaced cement at 15 barrels per minute (bpm) with rig pumps at 8;150' MD/TVD. Lost 19 barrels (bbls) while pumping cement and an additional 68 bbls while displacing the cement in place. POOH with BHA to 6;495' MD/TVD and monitor well on trip tank. Flush choke and kill lines; observe losses at 3 bbl/hr. Boost riser; and loss rate slowed to 0.5 bbl/hr. TIH and tag TOC at 7;406' MD. POOH to 7;002' MD/TVD above suture and spot LCM pill. Pull above pill and squeeze into formation (159 bbls squeezed). Current mud weight is 11.5 ppg SBM.

02/22/2016: Bled back 16 bbls after squeezing; then opened annular and monitored well. No flow. TIH and tag TOC at 7;406' MD and circulated bottoms up. Pump out of hole to 6;483' MD. Lost 44 bbls while pumping out of hole. Circulated bottoms up and monitored well; losing at 3.5 bbls/hr. TIH and tag TOC then POOH to 7;395' MD. Pump 369 bbls (2;072 cu ft) of 17 ppg cement at 5 bpm. Displace cement and POOH to above the cement plug. Total of 240 bbls lost during cementing job. Monitor well on trip tank while WOC; no losses observed. POOH to above the BOP and function BSR and CSR from Toolpusher's Panel; Yellow Pod; Good test. Continue to POOH to 4;443' MD and function diverter from Driller's Panel; good test. Continue to POOH to surface. Inspected mule shoe and TIH with same to 2;826' MD. Current mud weight is 11.5 ppg SBM.

02/23/2016: Continue TIH and tag TOC at 7;114' MD. P/U to 7;109' MD. Pump 246 bbls (1;381 cu ft) of 17 ppg cement at 5 bpm. Displace cement and POOH to above the cement plug. No losses observed. Circulate drill string and POOH with mule shoe. M/U 18-1/8" x 21" BHA and TIH to 4;750' MD; proper displacement observed. Current mud weight is 11.5 ppg SBM.

02/24/2016: Continue TIH and tag TOC at 6;530' MD. Drilled cement to 6;605' MD and circulated bottoms up. Displaced to 11.7 ppg water based mud (WBM) and then pulled into shoe and prepared surface pits for WBM returns. Complete WBM displacement and POOH with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA to surface. Current mud weight is 11.7 ppg WBM.

02/25/2016: TIH with 18-1/8" x 21" BHA to 1;103' MD and function BSR/CSR from Driller's Panel; Blue Pod; good test. TIH to 6;500' MD; then pull (1) stand and perform diverter function test from Toolpusher's Panel; good test. Space out an perform BOP function test from Driller's Panel; Yellow Pod; good test. TIH to 6;500' MD and displace from 11.7 ppg WBM to 11.5 ppg WBM. Current mud weight is 11.5 ppg WBM.

02/26/2016: Completed mud weight reduction to 11.5 ppg. Commenced drilling; kicking off at 6;751' MD; and drilled ahead to 7;116' MD. Pumped out of hole to 6;632' MD and opened reamer. Open hole to 21" from 6;620' MD bit depth to 6;840' MD bit depth. Current mud weight is 11.5 ppg WBM.

02/27/2016: Continue opening hole to 21" to 7;116' MD bit depth. Drill head to 7;151' MD and circulated bottoms up. POOH with BHA to reconfigure with a rock bit due to slow ROP. Current mud weight is 11.5 ppg WBM.
"},{"   ":30,"WELL_NAME":"  001a","API12":608114066101,"WAR_START_DT":"2016-02-21","TEXT_REMARK":"02/21/2016: Displaced cement at 15 barrels per minute (bpm) with rig pumps at 8;150' MD/TVD. Lost 19 barrels (bbls) while pumping cement and an additional 68 bbls while displacing the cement in place. POOH with BHA to 6;495' MD/TVD and monitor well on trip tank. Flush choke and kill lines; observe losses at 3 bbl/hr. Boost riser; and loss rate slowed to 0.5 bbl/hr. TIH and tag TOC at 7;406' MD. POOH to 7;002' MD/TVD above suture and spot LCM pill. Pull above pill and squeeze into formation (159 bbls squeezed). Current mud weight is 11.5 ppg SBM.

02/22/2016: Bled back 16 bbls after squeezing; then opened annular and monitored well. No flow. TIH and tag TOC at 7;406' MD and circulated bottoms up. Pump out of hole to 6;483' MD. Lost 44 bbls while pumping out of hole. Circulated bottoms up and monitored well; losing at 3.5 bbls/hr. TIH and tag TOC then POOH to 7;395' MD. Pump 369 bbls (2;072 cu ft) of 17 ppg cement at 5 bpm. Displace cement and POOH to above the cement plug. Total of 240 bbls lost during cementing job. Monitor well on trip tank while WOC; no losses observed. POOH to above the BOP and function BSR and CSR from Toolpusher's Panel; Yellow Pod; Good test. Continue to POOH to 4;443' MD and function diverter from Driller's Panel; good test. Continue to POOH to surface. Inspected mule shoe and TIH with same to 2;826' MD. Current mud weight is 11.5 ppg SBM.

02/23/2016: Continue TIH and tag TOC at 7;114' MD. P/U to 7;109' MD. Pump 246 bbls (1;381 cu ft) of 17 ppg cement at 5 bpm. Displace cement and POOH to above the cement plug. No losses observed. Circulate drill string and POOH with mule shoe. M/U 18-1/8" x 21" BHA and TIH to 4;750' MD; proper displacement observed. Current mud weight is 11.5 ppg SBM.

02/24/2016: Continue TIH and tag TOC at 6;530' MD. Drilled cement to 6;605' MD and circulated bottoms up.
